 :
   

  

 Vi söker nu en BI-utvecklare med kompetens inom Oracle för ett uppdrag med placering i Stockholm eller Östersund.
   

  

 Uppdraget gäller ett handläggningsverktyg som används för projekt- och stödhantering av flera myndigheter och regioner i Sverige, inklusive samtliga 21 regioner, länsstyrelser samt andra statliga aktörer. Systemet har ett tillhörande BI-team som ansvarar för att samla in och analysera statistik om ärenden för att skapa en samlad bild av stödens fördelning samt hur användare och handläggare nyttjar verktyget.
   

  

 För att avlasta det befintliga BI-teamet finns nu behov av en ytterligare utvecklare med erfarenhet inom Oracle-miljö. Rollen som BI-utvecklare innebär arbete inom Business Intelligence i nära samarbete med det nuvarande teamet. Teknikstacken inkluderar Oracle Data Integrator, APEX samt Dimensional Insights Diver-plattformen för insamling, bearbetning och visualisering av data.

 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

description:

title: Erfaren embedded utvecklare
description:
**Erfaren Embedded utvecklare / Software Engineer**
 Till en av våra kunder inom försvarsindustrin söker vi nu en erfaren Embedded utvecklare /Software Engineer. Som en erfaren Embedded utvecklare / Software Engineer kommer du spela en viktig roll i vår kunds projekt. Här får du chansen att utveckla dina färdigheter som att vässa din förmåga att hantera komplexa system.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Ta ansvar för helheten och kommunicerar lösningar
* Arbeta med komplexa system där målet är att ta fram effektiva lösningar
* Säkerställa att våra operativa produkters tillgänglighet garanteras genom att hantera utgående komponenter
* Under utvecklingsfasen följer systemet genom utveckling, integration och verifiering.


**Din profil** 
 Vi söker dig som har en stark drivkraft att bidra till innovation och vara delaktig i stora projekt. Du har en bakgrund inom utveckling och en passion för att lära dig mer samt utvecklas inom yrket. Du har en förmåga att självständigt driva uppgifter framåt och skapa ett personligt nätverk. För att trivas i denna rollen har du:
   

  

* En civil- eller högskoleingenjörsutbildning inom datavetenskap, datornätverk, datakommunikation, programvaruteknik, Robotik, Tillförlitliga system, inbyggda system, teknisk fysik.
* Jobbat 5+ år som Embedded utvecklare /Software Engineer.
* Erfarenhet av /C++, Assembly, Rapid, data communication, object-oriented programming (OOP), Procedural Programming, Profibus, Modbus, I2C, Linux, Realtidsoperativssystem, VX Works, QNX, Rubus.
* Önskvärda kunskaper inom: : C#, .Net, Node.js, XML, HTML, Scrum, WCF, Git, Bitbucket, Visual Studio, MongoDB, iOS Development, SQL, MySQL, Azure,
* Erfarenhet från fordon-, försvarsmakt- eller tillverkningsindustrin är meriterande.
* Svenskt medborgarskap samt att du talar samt skriver svenska flytande

title: Operativ Teamledare för IT-supportavdelningen (Servicedesk manager)
description:
Som teamledare på IT-supportavdelningen ansvarar du för alla IT-tekniker på supportavdelningen.
  
Den här rollen är idealisk för dig som vill kombinera operativt arbete med att förbättra och utveckla processer.
  
Som teamledare kommer du att ha en operativ roll där ungefär 70 % av din tid kommer att ägnas åt att hantera ärenden och fungera som tekniskt stöd för teamet.
  
Resterande tid kommer att användas för att planera, prioritera och stödja teamet i deras dagliga arbete, samt att utveckla och följa upp KPI: er för att förbättra och effektivisera supportfunktionen.
  
Med hjälp av olika verktyg övervakas driftförhållanden och vi förväntas agera proaktivt i första hand samt reaktivt när det är påkallat. Avdelningen administrerar system, både internt och externt.
  
Du vägleder medarbetarna på avdelningen, ansvarar för den dagliga driften och säkerställer att vi upprätthåller en hög kvalitet – både på kort och lång sikt.
  
Du ansvarar för att Technix servicedesk håller en hög kvalité gentemot kunderna och att vi håller oss inom de uppsatta målen.
  
Du rapporterar och hanterar avvikelser, incidenter och förbättringsförslag för att hela tiden förbättra verksamheten.
  
Du bör vara serviceinriktad och ha lätt för att kommunicera med människor på ett lättillgängligt och tillmötesgående sätt på både svenska och engelska.
  
Du är vetgirig och skaffar dig kunskap om hur du ska lösa utmaningar. I rollen ingår även att genomgå utbildningar och certifieringar.
  
Du medverkar i onboardingen av kunder som ska ha en tjänsteleverans från avdelningen och samverkar med andra kollegor i den löpande kundleveransen.
  
Du kommer att ansvara för dokumentation och att processer samt rutiner är uppdaterade samt skapa nya processer och rutiner tillsammans med CTO.
  
Du rapporterar direkt till CTO.
  
Vi söker dig som
  
Har flerårig erfarenhet av att ha arbetat inom 1st och 2nd-line på en servicedesk med IT-support (meriterande hos en extern servicedesk, men inget krav)
  
Har kunskap inom Microsoft (Active Directory, Entra ID, Microsoft 365, Intune)
  
Har erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem
  
Har kunskap inom ITIL
  
Talar och skriver på svenska och engelska obehindrat
  
Är duktig på att dokumentera och utveckla arbetssätt
  
Kan delegera och leda i grupp
  
  

Vi erbjuder
  
Nyckelroll på avdelningen
  
Kollektivavtal
  
Vårdförsäkring
  
Friskvårdsbidrag
  
Bra lönevillkor
  
Bonus
  
  

Om Technix IT AB
  
Technix IT AB är ett framåtlutat IT-bolag som erbjuder produkter, mjukvara, IT-support, drift och IT-som-tjänstlösningar till privata och offentliga verksamheter.
  
Vi har bland de högsta partnerstatusarna i branschen bland de större tillverkare.
  
Vi är specialiserade inom bland annat Microsoft, Google, infrastruktur, automatiseringar, utveckling, nätverk, print, AV-utrustning mfl.
  
Vår teknikavdelning består av våra egna IT-konsulter, IT-tekniker, AV-tekniker, utvecklare och UX-designers.
  
Våra kunder finns primärt i hela Sverige, men vi levererar även support, drift och produkter till flertalet Nordiska och globala kunder.
  
Bolaget har sitt säte i Nacka i Stockholm, men finns även i Solna och Göteborg.
  
Bolaget omsatte ca 109 mkr 2024 och har 25 medarbetare.
  
Vi blev utnämnda som "Årets Nackaföretag 2024" av Nacka Kommun och Företagarna.
  
Övrigt
  
**Placering:** Stockholm
  
**Omfattning:** 100%

title: CRO Analyst/Content Specialist to Samsung
description:
*As CRO Analyst & Content Specialist you’ll have a direct impact on how customers experience one of the largest electronics eStores in the Nordics. It’s a unique opportunity to combine analytical thinking with creative problem-solving, and to work hands-on with both data and content.*

##### **About the Role**


Samsung is looking for a hands-on, data-driven, and creatively minded **CRO Analyst & Content Specialist** to join the Nordic Marcom & Customer Experience (CX) team. In this pivotal role, you will work to enhance conversion rates and improve customer journeys across Samsung’s Nordic eStore. This is a role where strategy meets execution – combining data, UX, and content in a fast-paced, collaborative setting.


You’ll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including marketing, UX, data analytics, and site owners, transforming insights into impactful, real-time improvements. Whether it’s optimizing checkout flows or refining on-page messaging, your work will directly influence engagement and sales performance.

##### **Key responsibilities include**

* **Conversion Optimization:** Plan and implement A/B tests across landing pages, product pages, and category layouts to improve performance and remove friction.

  

* **Content & Merchandising:** Optimize banners, promotional messaging, and on-site content to boost click-through rates and user engagement.

  

* **Performance Analysis:** Monitor key CRO metrics (bounce rates, conversion paths, time on site) using tools like Adobe Analytics, Content Square, and dashboards.


* **Collaboration:** Work alongside internal teams and European HQ stakeholders to ensure alignment and knowledge sharing.
* **Reporting:** Present weekly/monthly reports summarizing test results, insights, and future optimization opportunities.

  

* **Travel:** a minimum of 10 travel days to Poland is required.

  


##### **What We Are Looking For**


We’re seeking a candidate who is passionate about **user experience, optimization, and performance data**. You are structured, proactive, and able to work both independently and as part of a cross-functional team. You enjoy digging into analytics, running experiments, and turning insights into tangible improvements.

**To succeed in this role, we believe you have**

* A strong analytical mindset with a creative approach to problem-solving
* Experience with e-commerce CRO, UX testing, and performance optimization
* Familiarity with A/B testing platforms, content management systems, and tools such as Adobe Target, Content Square, Figma, and Adobe Analytics
* Excellent communication skills – able to translate complex data into actionable steps and share insights with both technical and non-technical audiences
* A genuine curiosity about user behavior and what drives digital performance


##### **Why Join Us**


This is more than just a job – it’s an opportunity to shape the customer experience of one of the largest electronics eStores in the Nordics. You’ll work in a fast-moving environment where testing, learning, and improvement are constant. Your insights won’t sit in a deck — they’ll be tested, implemented, and seen in real-time impact.


At Samsung, innovation and collaboration are part of the everyday culture. You’ll be part of a regional team focused on experimentation, performance, and continuous development. If you're passionate about data, UX, and content — and want to make a measurable difference — this is the role for you.

##### **About Samsung**


Samsung is one of the world’s leading technology brands, known for innovation, design, and market leadership across product categories including smartphones, TVs, and home appliances. The Nordic headquarters is located in Kista, Stockholm, where a dynamic and diverse team is driving digital transformation in one of the brand’s fastest-evolving regions.

##### **How to Apply**


This interim assignment, provided through Hammer & Hanborg is a long term position and is expected to start as soon as possible, but no later than two months of notice period. The role is based at Samsung’s office in Kista, Hybridwork is applicable.

  

Please submit your application as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis. Your resume must be in english. No cover letter is needed.


If you have any questions, feel free to contact:  

Erik Värendh – erik.varendh@hammerhanborg.com


We look forward to hearing from you!

 *At Hammer & Hanborg we make a difference between being competent and being the right person for a job. Competence is much more than a CV and we always match candidates based on potential, values and motivation. We think it’s important that it’s fun to work and we believe in collaboration based on trust and mutual respect. We strive to always encourage and challenge both ourselves and our clients to have the courage to develop and make change happen. We believe that Diversity and Inclusion are strengths and welcome all applicants. Together we create future professional life. You are welcome to join us. Please read more:* *hammerhanborg.com*

  

Hammer & Hanborg by Jurek is a member of Diversity Charter Sweden who works for a world where different ideas, knowledge, experiences, and competence count, where difference is a resource.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
Are you a Senior Product Designer? If so, Greenely is looking for an exceptional individual to join our team!  

  

We are looking for a **Senior Product Designer** with UX focus to join our team in Stockholm. As we are scaling, this role will be a crucial part of building the next generation of Greenely. In the role, you will lead the UX and UI design of our consumer-facing applications, from early discovery to implementation. Your expertise in creating seamless user experiences and visually compelling designs will play a key role in shaping the future of our products.

**What you’ll be doing**

* Lead work end-to-end in the Greenely app as well as in other channels.
* Collaborate closely with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to define and implement design solutions.
* Conduct user research and usability testing to inform design decisions.
* Create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs that enhance user experience.
* Ensure a cohesive design language and maintain consistency across all platforms.
* Drive innovation by staying up-to-date with design trends and best practices.

**What you'll need to succeed**

* **7+ years of experience** in UX/UI design, with a proven track record of leading design efforts from discovery to launch.
* Experience working with well-established consumer app companies.
* Strong understanding of UX principles and the ability to simplify complex user flows.
* Expertise in creating visually appealing and functional UI designs.
* Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Sketch, or Adobe Creative Suite.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to present and justify design decisions.
* A results-driven mindset, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
  

**What we can offer you** ‍ **:**

  

* *Flexibility*: We are an office-first company that values in-person collaboration, offering flexible work arrangements to support your work-life balance. Our vibrant office is conveniently located in the heart of Stockholm at Vasagatan 40.
* *Growth*: Elevate your career with opportunities for skill development, challenging projects, and advancement within our forward-thinking organization.
* *Influence and Impact*: Your voice matters. Shape the future of energy by contributing your ideas, expertise, and playing a key role in decision-making.
* *Innovative Environment*: Thrive in an ever-changing industry, working on cutting-edge projects and staying ahead of the curve in a dynamic and pioneering work atmosphere.

 **About Greenely**

  

Greenely is on a mission to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. As a digital energy provider, we help people reduce their electricity costs by optimizing their home and car's electricity usage with our smart app. Supported by Nordic venture capital companies, we aim to enable households worldwide to connect, control, and optimize their energy usage. We believe that the best electricity is the one that is never used - a win-win for both wallets and the environment!  

  

WE ARE **bold and push the limit.**

WE BELIEVE THAT **f****ast is better than slow.**

WE **t****hink like owners.**

WE **lead with knowledge.**

 *Kindly, we do not accept applications via email as we protect your privacy. Thank you for your understanding.*

title: UX/UI designer, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Be a part of creating the digital customer experiences of the future with us at PostNord. Join the UX design team in Stockholm!
   

  

 Join the UX team at PostNord and help shape outstanding customer journeys with a user-centered mindset. As a UX/UI designer, you’ll collaborate with fellow designers within a dedicated user segment, working on multiple services to create seamless and impactful experiences.
   

  

 Join us
   

  

 We, the UX team, are working in an agile environment where the teams independently owns the product from start to finish. Within the team, it is important that everybody has their say, and we always strive to improve our way of working.
   

  

 Our head office is in Solna, Stockholm
 ***.***
 We make sure to meet each other in our office in Solna, at least three days per week.
   

  

 Find out more and follow us on LinkedIn!
   

  

 ,
   

  

 To be successful in this role, we believe that you are a UX/UI designer that wants to be a key player and take ownership. You will work closely with business, product owners, developers and other UX designers and make sure we build the best customer journeys.
   

  

 As a person, we believe that you are full of initiative and solution oriented. You have good communication skills and thrive when you get to work both practically and close to our users. You are no stranger with facilitating meetings or workshops and visualizing requirements. You have great knowledge and experience in designing for web and native applications for iOS/Android.
   

  

 You have a great personal drive and adapt efficiently to new information and insights. Like us, you value teamwork and building great solutions together.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

* Relevant education in UX design, interaction design, service design or equivalent field.
* Minimum 3 years of work experience as a UX/UI designer
* Facilitation skills and able to take ownership and get things done
* Design user flows and interfaces for our digital services in Figma
* The ability to analyze and design user flows based on insights collected via interviews and other mediums such as Hotjar/Google Analytics
* Experience in designing user interfaces for both web and native apps
* Understands graphic design and typography
* Understands designing for accessibility and WCAG requirements
* Experience in planning and conducting user tests
* Fluent Swedish and English


 Job Responsibilities
   

  

* Conducting user research, both qualitative and quantitative, as well as analyzing and presenting insights to revenant product teams and the whole department
* Analyzing and following up on user research
* Designing overall user flows and interfaces for our digital services on the web
* Working closely with product owners, other designers and other stakeholders within PostNord
* You’ll be responsible in aligning your work with other UX designers and user segments, on how it might affect PostNord’s multiple customer journeys.


**We offer you**
* A great team, you are part of a team with a focus on creating amazing customer-facing solutions at Postnord.
* Agile is our way of working, we have weekly’s, daily's, refinement meetings and sprint retros.
* Flexible hybrid workplace with an open working climate.
* To be part of a large organization with endless development opportunities for you as a UX designer and individual.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions.
* Wellness allowance and access to office gym and swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus.
* Employment according to a collective agreement.


 We make everyday life easier
   

  

 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com.
   

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

 Apply
   

  

  

  

  

  

 What are you waiting for? Send your application. Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, email sonja.prest@postnord.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

  

  

 Read more about our union representatives.

title: Operativ Teamledare för IT-supportavdelningen (Servicedesk manager)
description:
**Om jobbet** 




  





 Som teamledare på IT-supportavdelningen ansvarar du för alla IT-tekniker på supportavdelningen.
 



  





 Den här rollen är idealisk för dig som vill kombinera operativt arbete med att förbättra och utveckla processer.
 



  





 Som teamledare kommer du att ha en operativ roll där ungefär 70 % av din tid kommer att ägnas åt att hantera ärenden och fungera som tekniskt stöd för teamet.
 



 Resterande tid kommer att användas för att planera, prioritera och stödja teamet i deras dagliga arbete, samt att utveckla och följa upp KPI:er för att förbättra och effektivisera supportfunktionen.
 



  





 Med hjälp av olika verktyg övervakas driftförhållanden och vi förväntas agera proaktivt i första hand samt reaktivt när det är påkallat. Avdelningen administrerar system, både internt och externt.
 



  





 Du vägleder medarbetarna på avdelningen, ansvarar för den dagliga driften och säkerställer att vi upprätthåller en hög kvalitet – både på kort och lång sikt.
 



  





 Du ansvarar för att Technix servicedesk håller en hög kvalité gentemot kunderna och att vi håller oss inom de uppsatta målen.
 



  





 Du rapporterar och hanterar avvikelser, incidenter och förbättringsförslag för att hela tiden förbättra verksamheten.
 



  





 Du bör vara serviceinriktad och ha lätt för att kommunicera med människor på ett lättillgängligt och tillmötesgående sätt på både svenska och engelska.
 



  





 Du är vetgirig och skaffar dig kunskap om hur du ska lösa utmaningar. I rollen ingår även att genomgå utbildningar och certifieringar.
 



  





 Du medverkar i onboardingen av kunder som ska ha en tjänsteleverans från avdelningen och samverkar med andra kollegor i den löpande kundleveransen.
 



  





 Du kommer att ansvara för dokumentation och att processer samt rutiner är uppdaterade samt skapa nya processer och rutiner tillsammans med CTO.
 



 Du rapporterar direkt till CTO.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som** 




  




* Har flerårig erfarenhet av att ha arbetat inom 1st och 2nd-line på en servicedesk med IT-support (meriterande hos en extern servicedesk, men inget krav)
* Har kunskap inom Microsoft (Active Directory, Entra ID, Microsoft 365, Intune)
* Har erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem
* Har kunskap inom ITIL
* Talar och skriver på svenska och engelska obehindrat
* Är duktig på att dokumentera och utveckla arbetssätt
* Kan delegera och leda i grupp



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




  




* Nyckelroll på avdelningen
* Kollektivavtal
* Vårdförsäkring
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Bra lönevillkor
* Bonus







**Om Technix IT AB** 




  





 Technix IT AB är ett framåtlutat IT-bolag som erbjuder produkter, mjukvara, IT-support, drift och IT-som-tjänstlösningar till privata och offentliga verksamheter.
 



  





 Vi har bland de högsta partnerstatusarna i branschen bland de större tillverkare.
 



 Vi är specialiserade inom bland annat Microsoft, Google, infrastruktur, automatiseringar, utveckling, nätverk, print, AV-utrustning mfl.
 



  





 Vår teknikavdelning består av våra egna IT-konsulter, IT-tekniker, AV-tekniker, utvecklare och UX-designers.
 



  





 Våra kunder finns primärt i hela Sverige, men vi levererar även support, drift och produkter till flertalet Nordiska och globala kunder.
 



  





 Bolaget har sitt säte i Nacka i Stockholm, men finns även i Solna och Göteborg.
 



 Bolaget omsatte ca 109 mkr 2024 och har 25 medarbetare.
 



 Vi blev utnämnda som "Årets Nackaföretag 2024" av Nacka Kommun och Företagarna.

title: Head of Custody - Crypto/Fintech (Malta)
description:
**Why Aqovia?**

**At the Intersection of Innovation and Impact, introducing Aqovia**. Aqovia is a UK-based technology firm dedicated to creating tangible value through the power of AI, data-driven, and bespoke software solutions and services.


Our unique approach extends beyond traditional service and solutions delivery, we strategically invest in and nurture a diverse portfolio of promising companies operating across vital sectors including; financial services, health, infrastructure management, sustainability, education, and business intelligence.


This commitment to fostering innovation across a broad spectrum allows Aqovia to stay at the cutting edge, delivering transformative solutions and creating significant impact. For our clients and strategic partners, Aqovia offers a unique opportunity to be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking group shaping the future


**Join us and help shape the future of fintech and digital assets.**

 **Overview:**


The Head of Custody is responsible for overseeing the secure custody and safekeeping of crypto-assets for the Crypto-Asset Service Provider (CASP), in line with the Markets in Crypto-Assets Regulation (MiCA) authorisation for custody services, in addition to the company’s Electronic Money Institution (EMI) operations. Based in Malta, this role ensures the integrity, security, and accessibility of clients’ crypto-assets, implementing robust custody policies and procedures to meet MiCA’s stringent requirements. The Head of Custody collaborates with the CEO, CSO, and compliance teams to safeguard assets and maintain regulatory compliance in a rapidly evolving fintech landscape.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Oversee the custody and safekeeping of crypto-assets, ensuring compliance with MiCA requirements for secure storage, client asset segregation, and accessibility.
* Develop and implement custody policies, including key management, wallet security (hot/cold storage), and disaster recovery plans specific to crypto-assets.
* Manage the operational processes for depositing, withdrawing, and transferring crypto-assets, ensuring efficiency, security, and transparency for clients.
* Coordinate with the CSO to integrate custody security measures with the broader ICT and cybersecurity framework under MiCA and ISO 27001 standards.
* Liaise with the Head of Compliance and MLRO to ensure custody operations align with AML/CTF obligations and MiCA client protection standards, reporting to the MFSA as required.

**Qualifications:**

* Degree in finance, business, information technology, or a related field; certifications in blockchain, crypto custody, or security (e.g., CISM, CCSP) are highly desirable.
* At least 7 years’ experience in custody, asset management, or security leadership, preferably within fintech, crypto-assets, or financial services.
* In-depth knowledge of MiCA custody requirements, crypto wallet technologies, and secure asset management practices.
* Proven ability to design and manage custody systems, with strong expertise in risk management and operational resilience for crypto-assets.
* Excellent organizational and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate across teams and engage with regulators effectively.

 **Why Join Aqovia?**

* **Impactful Work** – Be part of a high-growth organisation shaping the future of fintech.
* **Career Growth** – We invest in talent and provide opportunities for professional advancement.
* **Collaborative Culture** – We value teamwork, transparency, and continuous learning.
* **Comprehensive Benefits** – Competitive salary, bonus, healthcare, gym membership, pension scheme, Perkbox, and more.

**Diversity & Inclusion**


Aqovia is committed to **building a diverse and inclusive workplace** that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and believe in fostering an environment where everyone is valued and empowered.


If you are an experienced fintech leader ready to drive Aqovia’s next phase of growth in Malta, we encourage you to apply!

 ***Note****: This position requires prior approval from the Malta Financial Services Authority (MFSA), including the submission of a Personal Questionnaire (PQ).*

title: Backend Engineer (Umeå)
description:
We are a team of dedicated software developers, big data engineers, data scientists, telco engineers, and sales professionals, with marketing, finance, HR, and other business professionals supporting the core roles.  

  

What we do at Elisa Polystar is not taught in textbooks. With us, you get to join in the pioneering work of AI-driven network analytics and assurance.  

  

We believe in transparency and a Nordic work culture – allowing you to make a significant contribution while maintaining a healthy work–life balance.


### **MEET**


  
### **Backend Engineer (Umeå) – Sweden**


At **Elisa Polystar**, we are at the forefront of telecom innovation. As a proud subsidiary of **Elisa Plc**, we are committed to driving sustainability through innovative digital solutions.


If you are a **passionate Software Engineer** with a keen interest in technology, this is your opportunity to join an exciting journey. Become a part of our software developmentteam located in Umeå, Sweden.

**What We’re Looking For:**

* **Core Java** – You have minimum two (or more) years of experience as a back-end developer
* **Linux and k8s Expertise** – Our software runs on Linux and k8s.
* **Databases Knowledge** – Minimum basic understanding of databases.
* **Curious Mindset** – Interested in learning more about telco concepts such as Radio Access Network?
* **Tech Enthusiast** – Enjoy working in a **creative,** **problem-solving, high-tech environment**.
* **Agile & Adaptable** – You thrive in fast-moving development environments.
* **Bonus points** – Experience with **telecom protocols, real-time systems or network programming.**

**What You’ll Do:**

* **Innovate & Optimize** – Work on a high-performance, **distributed** **monitoring system with backend in Java**, turning product requirements into powerful features.
* **Improve & Evolve** – Be part of continuous development, refining both product and processes.
* **Solve Real Challenges** – Get hands-on experience tackling interesting problems across internal and production systems.

**What You Can Expect as Part of Our Team:**

* Engaging technical challenges – the software handles massive amounts of data with 100+ live telecom customers.
* A collaborative team environment where everyone supports each other.
* Opportunities to learn from your teammates.
* Mastering our technical scope can seem daunting at first, but our team excels at helping new members get up to speed!

**Why Elisa Polystar?**

* **Hybrid & Flexible Work** – Find a balance between office and remote work.
* **Growth-Oriented Culture** – Being part of Elisa group, we support your learning and career development.
* **Be Part of Telecom innovators** – Help shape the future of the industry.


Interested? Please by **the end of May**! We look forward to hearing from you!


Note that the final candidate will be subject to a background check.

title: IT-arkitekt/lösningsarkitekt
description:
**Sista ansökningsdatum:** 30 maj 2025  

**Referensnummer:** 15118

  

**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidareanställning

  


**Kontaktperson:**  

  



Michael Lööw, Utvecklingschef, 013-20 68 08, Michael.Loow@linkoping.se


Anita Thor, Facklig representant Vision, 013-26 39 51, anita.thor@linkoping.se


Emelie Törnvall, Rekryteringskonsult på AS&B Executive, 070-618 11 58, emelie.tornvall@asb-executive.se


  
Var med och skapa verklig samhällsnytta tillsammans med oss på Linköpings kommun. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta med innovativa IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för både invånare och medarbetare i en dynamisk och framåtblickande organisation.



Dina arbetsuppgifter



Vill du vara med och skapa moderna, användarvänliga lösningar som förenklar vardagen för Linköpingsbor och våra medarbetare? Då har vi ett spännande uppdrag för dig! Vi erbjuder en tjänst där du får använda din passion för lösningsarkitektur till att utveckla lösningar för en modern och effektiv kommun. Var med och identifiera nya möjligheter genom omvärldsbevakning och analys av användarbehov tillsammans med oss på Linköpings kommun.



Din huvudsakliga roll kommer att vara som lösningsarkitekt. I arbetet kommer du att använda vår referensarkitektur, som du också kommer att vara med och vidareutveckla. Utifrån krav och behov utvecklar du lösningar som i sin tur levereras som tjänster till verksamheten. Det kan handla om allt från nya e-tjänster för medborgare till effektivisering av interna processer genom smarta verksamhetssystem, där ditt arbete bidrar till både ökad nytta och god resurshantering. I arbetet ingår att framställa lösningsarkitektur, vilket inkluderar kostnadskalkylering, kommunicera med mjukvaruutvecklare, delta i utformning av tjänsteinnehåll och av leveransmodell samt upphandlingsprocess. Du har en viktig roll i projektet från idé-stadie fram till att systeminförande genomförts och acceptanstester godkänts.



Du arbetar i team med kollegor inom IT och verksamhetsrepresentanter samt har stöd av våra Service Management-processer som följer ITILs ramverk. Hos oss får du stöd från erfarna mentorer, kollegor och chefer.



Din arbetsplats



LKDATA är en växande organisation som strävar efter att kombinera IT-expertis med kommunal verksamhet. Tillsammans med vårt team av över 100 kollegor, ansvarar vi för att säkra en stabil och modern IT-miljö som spänner över många olika tekniker och plattformar,för över 10 000 användare.



Vi erbjuder en trivsam arbetsplats där du får prova nya saker, ha frihet under ansvar samt i hög grad påverka och se hur ditt arbete gör en verklig skillnad för verksamheten. Du blir en del av ett engagerat och kompetent team där vi stöttar varandra och delar kunskap. Vi gillar utveckling och hos oss får du utvecklas genom de kurser vi erbjuder och att växa i ditt ansvar. Vi har moderna lokaler i Ebbepark och samarbetsplattformen Google Workspace som tillsammans stödjer flexibelt och kreativt arbetssätt. Här erbjuds du möjlighet till distansarbete och en god balans mellan arbete och fritid.



Linköping befinner sig i en spännande fas av digital utveckling och utsågs hösten 2023 till den mest innovativa staden i Europa av iCapital Award. Vi är i framkant av digital transformation och arbetar aktivt med att utveckla nya arbetssätt och IT-stöd. Hos oss får du vara med och driva denna utveckling framåt och bidra till att skapa en modern och effektiv kommun för alla invånare.



Du som söker



Vi söker dig som delar vår entusiasm för teknikens möjligheter. Vi ser att du har relevant högskoleexamen inom IT eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet. Det är önskvärt att du tidigare har arbetat som lösningsarkitekt men inte ett krav. Viktigast är att du har viljan, förmågan och tillräckliga kunskaper för att utforma lösningsarkitektur. Därför ser vi det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling, service design, processkartläggning, nyttokalkyler och tjänstebeskrivning. Har du dessutom erfarenhet inom projektledning och verksamhetsutveckling samt besitter kunskaper motsvarande ITIL Foundation ser vi det som meriterande. Eftersom tjänsten innebär att vara i regelbunden kontakt med olika team, skrivande av rapporter och hantering av teknisk information, behöver du ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift.



Som person är du strategisk och kreativ, och trivs med att hantera komplexa frågor och omsätta behov, teorier och metoder till praktiska tekniska lösningar. I ditt arbete drar du också nytta av din ekonomiska och affärsmässiga medvetenhet. Din förmåga att ha struktur, ta initiativ och tydligt kommunicera med dina projektmedlemmar kommer att vara avgörande i denna roll, där du kommer att arbeta med flera uppdrag samtidigt. Rollen innebär många samarbetsytor och vi ser därför att du har en naturlig talang för att skapa kontakter och hitta samarbeten inom vår organisation. Vi söker en teamspelare som trivs i en dynamisk arbetsmiljö och kan bidra till en positiv atmosfär.



Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!



Övrig information


*När du söker en tjänst i Linköpings kommun registrerar du din ansökan genom inloggning via e-legitimation (såsom BankID eller FrejaID) istället för e-postadress. Saknar du e-legitimation? Vänligen kontakta ansvarig HR-konsult eller chef, så hjälper de dig att registrera din ansökan.*  

  

Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse



Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning



Sysselsättningsgrad: 100%



Antal lediga befattningar: 1



Ref. nr: 15118


*I denna ansökan bifogar du inget personligt brev*


  
Tillsammans formar vi framtidsstaden


Linköping är en av Europas mest innovativa städer och möjligheternas kommun. Med energi, mod och hjärta gör vi vår stad ännu bättre. Vi drivs av nyfikenheten och viljan att hitta nya lösningar. Och av att förgylla vardagen och förbättra livskvaliteten för våra invånare.

title: IT/systemutveckling
company: Miljö Och Hälsa i Värmland AB
description:
Utveckla och underhålla mobilappar för iOS och/eller Android
  
Arbeta med ramverk som React Native, Flutter eller Swift/Kotlin
  
Delta i planering, design och testning
  
Samarbeta med designers och andra utvecklare
  
Följa nya trender och tekniker inom mobilutveckling

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Om Early Bird**


Med hjärtat i det fria ordet levererar vi för ett hållbart samhälle. Tillsammans med morgontidningen levererar vi det du beställt hos din e-handlare direkt till postlådan eller dörren, redo för dig att plocka in när du vaknar för dagen, smidigt och hållbart. Vi strävar hela tiden för att förbättra vårt hållbarhetsarbete och har siktet på att vara det mest hållbara leveranssättet i Sverige. Vi jobbar för att bli helt utsläppsfria redan år 2030, vilket är branschens mest ambitiösa mål. Vi tar avstamp i FN:s globala hållbarhetsmål och är godkända av den internationellt ansedda organisationen Science Based Targets Initiative.


Vi söker nu efter en **Data Engineer** till vår Tech avdelning.

**Om rollen:**


Vi söker en engagerad och lösningsorienterad Data Engineer som vill vara med och bygga vår moderna dataplattform! Hos oss får du jobba i ett team där samarbete och lärande står i centrum, och där vi tillsammans utvecklar effektiva och hållbara lösningar för att möjliggöra datadrivna beslut i hela verksamheten.


Du kommer vara en del av ett mindre datateam som arbetar tight tillsammans och har nära dialog och samarbete med olika team och roller i företaget. Du kommer främst att arbeta i Google Cloud Platform med verktyg som dbt, BigQuery, Kubernetes och Terraform. Rollen passar dig som både gillar att bygga stabila pipelines och att bidra med idéer kring hur vi kan förbättra våra plattformar och arbetssätt.

**I rollen kommer du att**:

* Utveckla, optimera och automatisera dataflöden i en molnbaserad miljö.
* Bygga självbetjäningslösningar som gör det enkelt att använda data på ett strukturerat och spårbart sätt.
* Delta i design av datamodeller och analyssystem för olika delar av verksamheten.
* Samarbeta nära andra utvecklare, dataanalytiker och verksamhetsrepresentanter.
* Bidra till ett lärande teamklimat där vi delar kunskap och ständigt utvecklas.

**Vem du är:**


Du har några års erfarenhet av arbete som Data Engineer eller liknande roll, och trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Som person är du strukturerad, initiativrik och prestigelös. Du är också pragmatisk i ditt arbete och är inte rädd för att ta initiativ när du ser förbättringsmöjligheter.


Vi tror att du har:  

* Erfarenhet av molnbaserad dataplattformsutveckling, gärna i Google Cloud Platform.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av programmering i ett professionellt sammanhang.
* Vana att arbeta med verktyg som dbt, Kubernetes och Terraform.
* Erfarenhet av versionshantering med Git.
* God kommunikationsförmåga och behärskar svenska väl, både muntligt och skriftligt.
* Akademisk utbildning inom datateknik, systemvetenskap eller liknande.
  

Meriterande:

* Kunskaper i Devops

  

Arbetsplats:


Hos oss är balansen mellan arbete och privatliv viktig, och därför erbjuder vi full flexibilitet i var du arbetar. Du har möjlighet att arbeta 100% på distans, men vi ser gärna att du kommer till våra kontor i Stockholm vid behov.

 **Vad vi erbjuder**

**Kultur**


Early Bird är ett snabbväxande, föränderligt företag. Vi vågar ställa stora krav på oss själva och är ambitiösa i våra mål! Vi välkomnar personer som vill vara med på denna spännande resa. Här hittar du kollegor som är trevliga, ödmjuka och familjära. Vi är inkluderande, ansvarsfulla, modiga, och engagerade.

**Förmåner**


Vi har flera olika förmåner vi erbjuder våra anställda, nedan får du en inblick i vad vi erbjuder!

* Kollektivavtal via Almega/Unionen
* 30 semesterdagar + 3 SKL dagar + klämdagar
* 4000 sek friskvårdsbidrag
* Löneutfyllnad (10%) vid VAB, max 10 dagar/år
* ITP pensionsavsättning
* 20% rabatt på Synoptik (för dig och din familj!)
* Extra föräldralön vid föräldraledighet. Storlek beroende på hur lång anställningstid som föregått ledigheten
company_description: Är du ingen Early Bird? Lugn. Du behöver inte älska tidiga mornar lika mycket som våra bud. Det är viktigare att du är en ambitiös teamplayer som drivs av utmaningar- Låter det mer som dig?

title: Senior Solution Architect - Maestro(Kinaxis)- Supply...
description:
We are looking for a **Solution Architect – Maestro (Kinaxis) - Supply Chain Planning** for a global company in **Gothenburg, Sweden.**


We are looking for a skilled resource with proven experience in Kinaxis RapidResponse/Maestro.

**Specific competence needed:** Maestro/Kinaxis RapidResponse Order Fulfillment.

**Start is in June, 6 month's limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**


**The Mission:**


Mission is to define and design the architecture for Maestro business applications / Supply Chain Planning digital products within the organization, ensuring maximum value for customers. The candidate is accountable to define the target map for digital initiatives across teams, ensuring alignment of technology choices with one North Star Architecture and D&IT CAST.


The candidate is typically part of the team collaboration circle in Stable Teams Framework and support one or multiple product teams, constantly engaging the Tech Lead in such teams. Collaborate with the Enterprise Architect for strategic direction and follow established principles and guidelines, ensuring adherence to standards. Focus is on technical decisions being made regarding solutions and how they meet business needs.


A professional, leading the design of business applications or digital products which support digital business capabilities needs to realize the business strategy. Also support planning, development, deployment and maintenance of digital solutions within the company. The responsibilities also include functional or network leader roles within Architecture.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Business value driven design of Supply Chain Planning digital products / Maestro business application, covering applications, services and IT infrastructure, as well as the logical and physical interrelationships between its components.
* Analyse the technology environment, enterprise specifics.
* Design and document IT integration solutions using relevant platforms, support services, methods and guidelines.
* Design Application architecture that guides product development considering reuse of business components and modern architecture disciplines driven by North Star.
* Ensure usage of shared technical standards, tools, and platforms.
* Align with Company Security directives and fulfilling the customer demands for information security.
* Translate business requirements into IT architecture and describing it through a selection of architecture and design artifacts.
* Analyse functional and create non-functional requirements.
* Create solution prototypes.
* Participate in technology selection.
* Secure alignment of Architecture design with architecture principles from North Star.
* Contribute to Enterprise Architecture practices and Target Architecture development by addressing technical aspects of Enterprise Architecture and securing consistency with Business and Information architecture.
* Collaborate on multiple stages of the Business Architecture Framework, creating artifacts needed to define the business capabilities and how they are realized in the solution.

**This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Gothenburg. Start is in June, 6 months contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhal, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Software Engineer- Core Digital Infrastructure, Edge Computing & Distributed Hosting
description:
* **Job ID:** 289827
* **Date posted:** 01/05/2025
  

  

WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU  

  

We are looking for a passionate Software Engineer who strives for engineering excellence and excels in constantly changing environments. You are excited about systems architecture and modern technologies (Edge computing, IoT, PaaS offerings at a global scale). You want to take part in shaping the future of IKEA influencing the hosting services of approximately 500 distributed sites! We are looking for a new colleague.  

  

To succeed as a Software Engineer you will have:
  
* + We believe you have several years of managing Hyperconverged Infrastructure (HCI). You are willing to grow into other Infrastructure area such as Open-Source hosting.
	+ Good Experience of automation and scripting/coding (Go, Terraform, Ansible, Python, PowerShell) to enable infrastructure automation
	+ Knowledge of common development concepts such as Git, CI/CD and working with REST API’s
	+ MS Windows and Linux server experience
	+ Knowledge in server management, monitoring, dashboard creation in enterprise environment
	+ Basic knowledge of Network stack
	+ Constant desire to learn, improve and enable other to grow in your area of expertise
	+ Experience from a retail or distribution business is beneficial, but not mandatory.
	+ We believe you have experience in designing and managing high availability solution including clustering.
  

A DAY IN YOUR LIFE WITH US  

As a Software Engineer within Distributed Hosting Store/Office, you will be a part of the team responsible for designing and delivering well designed, secured and scalable core infrastructure solutions to support consumers across IKEA globally on our distributed sites. You will be surrounded by skilled & experienced engineers that are organized in small fully empowered Agile teams. Distributed Hosting Store/Office Team has co-workers in Sweden (Helsingborg and Älmhult) and China (Shanghai).
  

We are on a journey to assist our consumers with shifting from traditional compute solutions into scalable, loosely coupled & secure patterns that help improve the business objectives and enable agility, scalability and flexibility for our consumers.  

  

QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!  

The role is based in Helsingborg, and you will report into the Engineering Manager of The Distributed Hosting Store/Office. If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, please reach out to the recruiter, Rosie Geraghty- rosie.geraghty@ingka.com
  

  

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they’re 100% “qualified”. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think. We look forward to receiving your application.
  

From: “Why Women Don’t Apply for Jobs Unless They’re 100% Qualified” by Tara Sophia Mohr, August 2014”
  

  

We will be interviewing continuously and are looking forward to hearing from you!

title: IT Business Analyst (Credit Risk)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Financial Services team is at the forefront of this mission. As a reliable partner we guide our customers such as major banks and insurance companies with everything from strategy and planning to implementation and management.
   

  

**Your role**
 A crucial part of the IT Business Analyst role is to identify and analyze functional and technical requirements connected to Credit Risk. You are the link between the customer and the development team and will ensure that the applications meet the requirements of future users. The role has an established career path within Capgemini, where you will have the opportunity to grow into other roles in the long run.
   

  

 In this position you will play a key role in:
   

  

* Initiating business and process improvements.
* Capturing requirements through workshops with customers.
* Communicating with stakeholders about priorities, changing requirements and test results.
* An interest in new technologies.


**Your profile**
* 8-10 years prior IT experience within Financial Services.
* 3-4 years of functional background around Credit Risk and understanding of Credit Risk modelling, PD, LGD and EAD modelling.
* Experience in handling huge datasets.
* Knowledge of specifying and analyzing functional and technical requirements.
* Understanding of UT, ST and end-to-end UAT testing. Added advantage in creating functional test cases and validating the results.
* Experience in doing data analysis using SQL. Knowing SAS/Python is an added advantage.
* Experience from working with regulatory requirements, digitalization as well as agile methodology is meritorious.
* Fluency in Swedish is beneficial.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* You get to work with major customers within banking and insurance, in exciting and varied roles, giving you the opportunity to develop both personally and professionally.
* We keep everyone connected, with learning activities and social events. With the freedom to grow, you get access to a wide range of our global comprehensive training programs.
* We focus on inclusion and embrace and empower talent in all its diverse forms and origins.
* We are valuing work-life balance with flexible working arrangements in order for you to balance your work life with your personal life.


**Application**
 Don’t hesitate to send in your application. We will be interviewing continuously and look forward to finding our next colleague.
   

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Europe North Public Sector Leader, AGS
description:
**Description**
 The Head of Public Sector is a senior leadership team role in Europe North, responsible for all operations of the AWS Public Sector business across the eleven countries of the Nordics, Benelux and Baltics. They are responsible for leading a multi-country, multi-layer organization of sales, technical and business development professionals who deliver compelling value propositions that drive cloud adoption across all government, education, healthcare, nonprofit organizations, and state-owned enterprises in the region.
   

  

 This manager of managers role reports to the Europe North Managing Director, and is responsible for end-to-end ownership of our strategy, go-to-market, and execution in the AWS public sector business for the region. The right candidate will be able to engage at the highest levels of government and will possess strong influencing and communication skills, with the business acument to navigate a highly complex regulator landscape across countries of different maturity.
   

  

 This role provides an opportunity to impact, engage, shape, bring innovation and grow the adoption of cloud computing within the public sector for the greater benefit of society and these countries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 The ideal candidate will possess a senior customer leadership background that enables them to lead a diverse team of global sales leaders, customer account managers, partner and technical resources, engaging the broad public sector team.
   

  

 You will have the responsibility of mentoring and supporting the team so that pipeline and revenue quotas are achieved as well as defining territories and go-to-market strategy. Our growth will also mean that you will play an integral part with the growth and recruitment into the team.
   

  

* Develop strategic plans, set goals and quotas
* Hire and develop a multi-layer, multi-function orgnization, bringing in and cultivating the best talent in the industry
* Accelerate customer adoption and customer satisfaction, engaging at C-level or equivalent
* Work strategically with partners to extend AWS reach
* Collaborate with Senior Management, Finance, HR, Sales Operations, Sales Specialists, Marketing to align the team’s initiatives.
* Conduct regular reviews of business and performance including pipeline reviews, prospecting and closing deals
* Present regular, accurate reports to senior management for review
* Identify and drive program and business improvement on a regular basis


 We are also open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
   

  

* Amsterdam, Netherlands
* Stockholm, Sweden


 The successful candidate needs to be able to travel across the Europe North countries.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Successful experience leading in a matrix environment across multiple countries
* People/sales management direct experience in a multi-tiered organization and experience managing technology-related sales teams with direct quota responsibility
* Direct and indirect sales experience in working with European public sector organizations (Government, Education, Healthcare)
* Experience successfully building and executing go-to market plans for medium and large enterprise accounts, leading, motivating and developing talent. Full Professional English level and any Europe-North languages is a plus
* Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation and analytical skills, accurate and concise reporting


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Extensive knowledge of AWS products and services
* A technical or educational background in engineering, computer science, or MIS
* MBA/MS degree in relevant field
* 50%+ Travel Time


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54

title: Junior Linux System Administrator
description:
**About The Role**
**The** 
**Role: Junior Linux System Administrator**
**The Team:** 
 The OSTTRA Technology team is composed of Capital Markets Technology professionals, who build, support and protect the applications that operate our network. The technology landscape includes high-performance, high-volume applications as well as compute-intensive applications, leveraging contemporary microservices, cloud-based architectures
   

  

**The** 
**Impact: Together** 
 , we build, support, protect and manage high-performance, resilient platforms that process more than 100 million messages a day. Our services are vital to automated trade processing around the globe, managing peak volumes and working with our customers and regulators to ensure the efficient settlement of trades and effective operation of global capital markets
   

  

**What’s in it for you:** 
 We are looking for highly motivated technology professionals who will strengthen our specialisms and champion our uniqueness to create a company that is collaborative, respectful, and inclusive to all.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will be working in a team that installs and maintains all server hardware. On this hardware, we install and maintain software and administer performance and ensure availability
* You will be part of troubleshooting problems You will be engaged in continuous testing of new Linux versions and applications
* The team also design and maintains system tools for automation and other tasks
* We are on-call in a route where you will be included when it is suitable
* The work is structured and we work with processes, and routines and perform change management to ensure high-quality


**What We’re Looking For**
* An education in IT above primary school - or an equivalent area of technical experience
* Minimum 5 years of Industry experience working with server systems with Linux OS (RHEL, Rocky Linux etc)
* Fluent in English
* Experience working in data centres is a plus


**About Company Statement**
 OSTTRA is a market leader in derivatives post-trade processing, bringing innovation, expertise, processes and networks together to solve the post-trade challenges of global financial markets. OSTTRA operates cross-asset post-trade processing networks, providing a proven suite of Credit Risk, Trade Workflow and Optimisation services. Together these solutions streamline post-trade workflows, enabling firms to connect to counterparties and utilities, manage credit risk, reduce operational risk and optimise processing to drive post-trade efficiencies.
   

  

 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. These businesses have an exemplary track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure and bring together an established community of market participants comprising all trading relationships and paradigms, connected using powerful integration and transformation capabilities.
   

  

**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

title: Global Lead Analyst IT Compliance. Octapharma Kungsholmen
description:
Do you want to combine the opportunities that a global company provides with the benefits of a family-owned business? Headquartered in Lachen near Zurich, Switzerland, the Octapharma Group is a leading company in the worldwide market for therapeutic human proteins. Working at Octapharma means to have an opportunity to contribute to our common goal – developing lifesaving therapies to improve patients’ lives.
   

  

 The position is based at our production site in Kungsholmen, Stockholm.
   

  

 What will you be doing as Group Lead Analyst IT Compliance?
   

  

* As a part of the Global IT team, you will work closely together with IT teams as well as other business stakeholders, to maintain and further develop the Octapharma quality management system to ensure compliant management of computerised systems
* You will participate in the development of strategic roadmaps and be an important contributor in the strive for compliant, fully digital, efficient processes that can be implemented at a global scale. We strive to support and implement agile principles where possible
* Daily work will include coordination and IT compliance support for our corporate business applications. You will train and support IT and business stakeholders in the principles of computer system validation and oversee that these requirements are covered during the application lifecycle
* Project and/or validation lead responsibility could additionally be required for critical, designated projects
* Support for audits and health authority inspections


 Who are you?
   

  

* You have a university degree in Information Technology, Engineering or similar (bachelor or higher) and at least 10 years of experience in computer system validation and qualification, from the pharmaceutical or medical device industry
* We expect leadership or people management experience (two years or longer), in a role as manager, team lead or project manager
* You have excellent communication and presentation skills and is fluent in both English and Swedish
* You are a collaborative team member who enjoys changes, challenges and problem solving. We expect you to demonstrate both responsibility and Initiative


 What's the best thing about working with us?
   

  

* You help save lives - Every day is meaningful as we produce life-saving medicines
* Family values - Long-term perspective for employees and relationships
* Be rewarded with an attractive salary and benefits package
* You will have a high level of influence where you can make a difference and leave your footprint
* Work with skilled and fun colleagues in a relatively informal organization
* Skills development - We offer various internal and external employee and leadership trainings, trainee programs and digital solutions


 Apply Today!
   

  

 Please apply in English. If you have questions about the position, contact Johanna Hermansson (Responsible recruiter) at johanna.hermansson@octapharma.com. The application deadline Is 2025-04-30, but the position may be filled before then.
   

  

 If you proceed in the process
   

  

* We want to gather as much Information as possible early in the process to make the best match. Within a few days, you will perform work psychological assessment tests
* The assessment tests are done early in the process because we want to ensure an objective, unbiased and fair selection process


 Would you like to get to know us better? Learn more about us on our website and follow us daily on LinkedIn!

title: OT Security Consultant
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About The Accelerator**
 We rapidly nurture successful businesses and services that will shape the future of assurance. The Accelerator operates a portfolio of units undergoing significant growth, chiefly through acquisitions and partnerships. The Accelerator acts as a greenhouse for a strategically selected portfolio of businesses, each of which serves different industries and markets. The portfolio benefits from dedicated support to rapidly grow through organic means, as well as through acquisitions and partnerships. Three business units were housed in the Accelerator in 2022: Cyber Security, Digital Health, and Inspection.
   

  

**About The Role**
 DNV has significant ambitions to grow the Cyber Security unit in the coming years. Building on our success and strengths in the Nordics and internationally we will make a global impact on safeguarding life, property and the environment.
   

  

 We are currently looking for talented
 **OT Security Consultants** 
 to join our growing Industrial & OT Cyber Security unit. This team provides cyber security assessments, technical verification and advisory services both onshore and offshore. You will be working on exciting customer projects in key industries including maritime, oil and gas, renewables, utilities and others.
   

  

 This role will offer you the opportunity to work alongside some of the most experienced specialists in the Industrial cyber security field. We aim to provide you with a fast-paced career that brings you opportunities to develop your competencies rapidly. We will invest in your career development, offering in-depth training and the chance to participate in industry-leading courses and projects.
   

  

**You will be based at one of our DNV offices in The Netherlands, Germany or Sweden.**
**Job Requirements**
 Broad general knowledge on OT applications and infrastructure with specific knowledge on several of the following:
   

  

* OT/IT Networks (switches, routing, firewalls)
* Must have experience working in an automation engineer background
* Firewall rules, logging, monitoring, IDS/IPS & troubleshooting (Checkpoint & Palo Alto)
* Enabling services (e.g NTP, SMTP, patching, AntiVirus)
* System integration technologies (OPC, XML, middleware)
* Server infrastructure (VMWare ESXi, storage)


**For More Information About The Position, Please Contact**
 Head of unit, Industrial and OT systems, Svante Einarsson at svante.einarsson@dnv.com
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Strong company culture with an emphasis on competence development
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support
* International working environment
* Exciting projects within critical sectors locally and internationally
* Competitive terms and conditions
* Flexible working hours and a focus on work/life balance
* Social events, sports and team building activities


 DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.
   

  

**About You**
**What You Bring:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a related technical field
* Minimum of 4+ years’ work experience in Operational Technology Security
* Expertise on securing OT network architecture
* Experience as an Automation / Controls Engineer
* Excellent presentation, written and verbal communication skills; ability to clearly communicate and have excellent consulting skills
* Ability to interact with high profile clients
* GICSP, CISSP, CISM or CFSE/CFSP certification.
* Fluent language skills in English and at least one additional European language
* Willingness to travel for approx. 25% of your time


 We work with clients that are related to critical infrastructure. A qualified candidate must be able to pass a screening background check.

description:
Wipro is a leading global information technology, consulting, and business process services company. We harness the power of cognitive computing, hyper-automation, robotics, cloud, analytics, and emerging technologies to help our clients adapt to the digital world and drive success. Recognized globally for our comprehensive portfolio of services, strong commitment to sustainability, and responsible corporate citizenship, we have over 260,000 dedicated employees serving clients across six continents. Together, we discover ideas and connect the dots to build a better and bold new future.

**Diversity and Inclusion at Wipro:** 




 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.
