title: Enterprise Architect – Marketing
description:
**Job Description**
 We at H&M Group, have a vision to liberate fashion for the many. Our
 **Enterprise Architecture team** 
 helps align and enable business and tech, provide holistic architecture direction and governance, balancing the long-term and the short-term. Using robust frameworks and best practices they support an effective and efficient tech delivery.
   

  

 To strengthen our team, we are now hiring more Enterprise Architects to further level up our support to business and tech in several areas.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 At H&M Group, our architecture landscape is divided into segments, here the
 **Marketing segment** 
 covers our
 **Marketing and Customer & Experience Management** 
 capabilities.
   

  

 As an
 **Enterprise Architect – Marketing** 
 , you will play a key role in shaping the future of our global MarTech and Customer & Experience landscape, ensuring alignment between business strategy and technological execution. You will work cross-functionally to define, optimize, and evolve our marketing technology landscape and help enable a seamless customer experiences across all touchpoints.
   

  

**You will:**
* Define and drive the Marketing and Customer & Experience technology architecture, ensuring alignment with business strategies and marketing transformation initiatives.
* Identify dependencies across business and technology capabilities, guiding stakeholders through necessary changes in process, information, and technology.
* Provide strategic guidance to stakeholders on investment decisions, evaluating risks, costs vs. benefits, and business impact.
* Shape and evaluate future initiatives, including new operating models and emerging technologies, applying innovations to optimize business and operating models.
* Analyze industry and market trends to identify opportunities and assess their impact on enterprise architecture.
* Develop and maintain architectural frameworks, standards, and best practices, ensuring alignment across teams and fostering architecture thinking within the engineering and delivery community.
* Oversee and facilitate architectural decision-making, ensuring the Marketing and Customer & Experience capabilities are positioned effectively within the enterprise landscape, with clearly defined business capabilities, target states, roadmaps, and guardrails.
* Collaborate with other architects and teams to design and implement key strategies, solutions, and current-state and transition architectures.


**YOU’LL WORK WITH**
 As an
 **Enterprise Architect** 
 , you will collaborate closely with architects across different architecture segments and areas of the organisation, ensuring seamless integration between Marketing, Customer & Experience, and the broader enterprise architecture. You will work alongside
 **Solution Architects,** 
 other
 **Enterprise Architects, and System Architects** 
 to define, optimize, and evolve our marketing technology landscape while ensuring alignment with enterprise-wide strategies.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Your role will bridge marketing, customer engagement, and digital experience with other architectural segments, enabling a cohesive and scalable Marketing and Customer & Experience landscape that supports business objectives across all touchpoints.
   

  

*We are looking for people with..*
* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering, computer science, technology, or a related field—or equivalent work experience. Certifications in Enterprise Architecture frameworks (e.g., TOGAF) are a plus.
* 15+ years of experience in software engineering, business technology, or related roles, including 10+ years in a Solution or Enterprise Architecture capacity.
* Deep technical knowledge in paid and organic marketing channel technologies, attribution modeling, and content optimization.
* Strong understanding of Loyalty programs, CRM, CMS, CDPs, social media, journey orchestration, and SEO tools.
* Familiarity with AI/ML applications in marketing and customer experience.
* Knowledge of Customer Service technologies (e.g., voice, chat, email, social messaging, in-store experiences) and their role in delivering exceptional customer support is a plus.
* Proven experience from working with business & tech stakeholders with documenting & communicating architecture using one or several formal notations using EA Tools such as LeanIX, showing multiple viewpoints and dimensions – e.g. process, capability, information, application, technology etc.
* Experience in architecture governance and formulating architecture principles, standards, guardrails etc.
* Experience in Data, AI & Automation architecture, designing for high-volume products for retail solutions


*And people who are..*
* Strategic visionaries, shaping the future-state architecture to support business growth.
* Collaborative partners, working across segments to ensure alignment and seamless integration.
* Analytical thinkers, who can assess complex systems and provide clear, actionable insights.
* Technology leaders, staying ahead of industry trends and emerging technologies to drive innovation.


**LOCATION:** 
 This is a
 **full-time position with a placement in STOCKHOLM, SWEDEN**
**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: SAP Senior Consultant (Demand to Supply)
description:
At PBS Nordics, a Capgemini business unit, we empower individuals to shape their careers within a collaborative global community.
   

  

 Specializing in ERP transformation services for both public and private sectors, PBS Nordics delivers tailored solutions using top ERP systems like SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, and IFS. With a strong Nordic presence and a diverse global client portfolio, we guide organizations through seamless ERP transformations, driving operational excellence and strategic growth.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an SAP Consultant, you will be responsible for optimizing end-to-end processes through SAP S/4 HANA, helping us improve efficiency, reduce costs, and deliver superior customer service. If you have a track record of implementing and supporting SAP solutions and are a true Team Player that is passionate about adding value to clients and want to advance your career, this could be the role for you!
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Lead the design, configuration, and implementation of SAP S/4HANA, ensuring it aligns with business requirements and best practices.
* Provide strategic advice and expertise to clients on SAP S/4HANA Integrated Business Planning (IBP), Production Planning and Detailed Scheduling (PP/DS), Manufacturing (PP), Digital Manufacturing (DM), Extended Warehouse Management (EWM), Transportation Management (TM), Quality Management (QM) and Enterprise Asset Management (EAM/PM).
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate with other SAP functional areas and external systems.
* Lead, Guide and Support junior consultants, fostering their professional growth and ensuring high-quality project delivery.
* Stay updated with industry trends and the latest developments in SAP S/4HANA and emerging technologies to continuously enhance service delivery.


**Your profile**
* Proven experience as an SAP Consultant, with at least 5 years of hands-on experience and track record in implementing and supporting SAP Solutions in a complex environment.
* Experience in a minimum of one S/4 transformation, SAP certification in relevant area and have a strong understanding of Supply Chain Management processes and best practices.
* Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment and strong communication skills, both written and verbal.


*Note: Nordic-based and fluency in English; proficiency in Swedish is preferred. Open to travel.*
**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations.
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness.
* A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person.


**Application**
*In this recruitment process, we review applications and hire on an ongoing basis. As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries.
   

  

 With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Business Intelligence Architect
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary & Job Responsibilities**
**Join Our Team as a BI Architect!**
 As a BI Architect, you will be responsible for the end-to-end flow from source to report, encompassing both technology and the way of working. You will play a pivotal role in shaping our data landscape and driving Scania's transition into a Data Mesh. Collaboration and communication are key to success in this role, as you will work closely with our developers, self-service users, and a wider architect community. You will communicate effectively at all levels of the company, from C-level management to juniors, and translate Scania's overall strategy into a BI strategy with a holistic long-term perspective.
   

  

 You will use your curiosity and open mind to identify new trends in data architecture, technology, and ways of working, bringing that knowledge into our global organization to enhance our capabilities. As an architect, you will drive change within your area and proactively initiate necessary actions.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You have a strong background with architectural work within global organisations, with an agile mindset and hands on approach to develop and drive architectural work.
   

  

 You have the ability to translate complicated technical discussions to business language and vice versa. You thrive in a global, complex and everchanging environment - where you build trust and drive change through continuous dialogue.
   

  

**More about you:**
 It is an advantage if you have previous experience:
   

  

  

* 10+ years of experience working as BI Architect.
* 5+ years of experience with deep understanding of Data Warehousing, known Data Warehousing patterns, Analytics and Business Intelligence
* 3+ years of experience working with reporting tool PowerBI (both on-premise and cloud) and also SSAS and SSRS
* 2+ years of experience with cloud architecture design for end to end BI use cases
* AWS knowledge
* Knowledge of DevOps and designing CI/CD pipelines
* Strong communication and documentation skills
* data mesh concepts


**This Is Us**
 Our department plays a crucial role in Scania's data strategy, delivering top analytical solutions. Our purpose is to provide the latest technology, tools, and expertise within data, enabling the business to plan, follow up, and improve its daily and long-term operations effectively and efficiently. We work in teams and squads, closely collaborating with the business to be Business & IT as One.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-02. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Group Manager Rosiane Andretta-Sundman, rosiane.andretta-sundman@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Business analyst inom offentlig sektor
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 På CGI ligger vi i framkant när det kommer till digitalisering och tillämpning av nya teknologier. Just nu söker vi medarbetare som delar vår passion och som har en erfarenhet som kravanalytiker.
   

  

 Vi söker en engagerad och erfaren Business Analyst med teknisk bakgrund inom offentlig sektor som kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att förstå, analysera och definiera krav för projekt inom offentlig sektor. Du kommer att arbeta nära både kunder och projektteam för att säkerställa att lösningarna lever upp till verksamhetens behov och mål.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som Business Analyst kommer du att ha en central roll i att stödja och utveckla våra IT-projekt och verksamhetsprojekt inom offentlig sektor. Din roll kommer att vara starkt kundinriktad, där du analyserar affärsbehov och formar skräddarsydda lösningar för att uppfylla deras krav.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Samla in, analysera och dokumentera krav från intressenter.
* Fungera som en brygga mellan verksamheten och IT.
* Skapa och visualisera kravmodeller, processkartor och användningsfall.
* Säkerställa att levererade lösningar möter de identifierade behoven.
* Bidra med insikter om trender och bästa praxis inom offentlig sektor.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Du är en initiativtagande person som trivs i en snabbväxande miljö. Som en del av vårt team förväntas du vara självgående men samtidigt en lagspelare. Du har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och en naturlig fallenhet för problemlösning.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har en bakgrund inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller annat relevant område och har mellan 3-5 års erfarenhet inom offentlig sektor. Du är även tekniskt kunnig och har förståelse för databaser och systemutvecklingsprocesser.
   

  

 Meriterande för denna tjänst är även om du är certifierad inom till exempel Scrum, SAFe, REQb.
   

  

 För den här tjänsten är det viktigt att du kan tala och skriva på svenska obehindrat. Eftersom våra kunder finns i offentlig sektor tillämpar vi även bakgrundskontroller.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan, har du några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att maila rekryterande ledare Lena Lundgren på Lena.Lundgren@cgi.com
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Head of Asset Integration
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

 With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a skilled Head of Asset Integration to join our Asset Management domain.
   

  

**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 As Head of Asset Integration, you will lead Flower’s Asset Integration team, comprising Technical Project Managers, Integration Engineers, and Software Engineers. Your mission is to ensure the team integrates renewable energy assets into our asset portfolio in a seamless and efficient manner. You will be responsible for setting strategic direction, fostering cross-functional collaboration, and ensuring our integration projects deliver both financial and societal value.
   

  

 This position may involve occasional site visits at different project stages. It is well suited for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, and enjoys working at the intersection of technology, energy and sustainability.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Define and execute the vision for integrating renewable energy assets, aligning technical initiatives with business objectives
* Lead, mentor, and inspire a multi-disciplinary team of technical experts
* Oversee complex integration projects, ensuring effective deployment of assets like batteries, solar, wind, and hydro within our grid portfolio
* Plan and adapt team size and structure to align with evolving project demands, ensuring optimal resource allocation and timely project delivery
* Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to drive process improvements and innovation
* Guide the team through high-level architecture and design decisions for system scalability, automation, IoT integrations to ensure robust, future-proof solutions
* Manage internal and external stakeholders, setting clear expectations and delivering projects on time and within scope


**Who You Are**
* A seasoned leader with a track record managing high-functioning technical teams
* You come with a rich technical background from renewable energy systems, asset integration, or a related engineering field
* Skilled in software development and IoT/hardware integration, with a noted ability to navigate complex, large-scale projects
* A strategic thinker and proactive problem-solver with some outstanding communication and stakeholder management skills
* Interested in the energy transition and committed to delivering sustainable solutions
* Experience within the energy sector—especially renewable energy or grid management—is highly desirable
* Proficiency in English


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 If you’re ready to lead a dynamic team and play a key role in powering the energy system of tomorrow, we’d love to hear from you. Please submit your application in English detailing relevant experience.
   

  

 Throughout the recruitment process you will meet a People & Talent Partner, peers from your future team, VP of Asset Management, as well as our CEO.
   

  

 —-
   

  

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Team Manager till Ceva Logistics
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Vill du arbeta i ett högt tempo med fokus på ledarskap, struktur och utveckling? Nu söker vi på Pokayoke, på uppdrag av Ceva Logistics, flera Team Managers till deras toppmoderna logistikcenter i Kungsängen. På anläggningen hanteras logistiken för en av världens största e-handelsaktörer – och du får chansen att vara med och driva den dagliga driften framåt.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som Team Manager hos Ceva Logistics ansvarar du för en avdelning i lagret där du leder och fördelar det dagliga arbetet. Du säkerställer att din grupp når sina mål inom kvalitet, effektivitet och säkerhet, i en miljö där förbättringsarbete och engagemang står i fokus. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med andra Team Managers och du rapporterar till en Shift Manager. Tjänsten kan vara placerad på både dag- och kvällsskift.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**
* Leda den dagliga driften inom din avdelning
* Planera och följa upp avdelningens mål och prestationer
* Kommunicera tydligt med ditt team och ge kontinuerlig feedback
* Coacha medarbetare enligt individuella utvecklingsplaner
* Säkerställa att arbetsmiljö, säkerhet och rutiner efterlevs
* Rapportera incidenter, risker och avvikelser
* Driva förbättringsarbete för att öka effektiviteten
* Bryta ner företagets strategier till konkreta och uppföljningsbara mål


**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som är en strukturerad och engagerad ledare, med förmåga att både stötta och utmana dina medarbetare i vardagen. Du är trygg i att fatta beslut, har en god kommunikativ förmåga och motiveras av att se andra växa. Du trivs i en dynamisk miljö där förändring är en del av vardagen.
   

  

**Vi ser att du har:**
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av ledarskap, gärna inom logistik, produktion eller lager
* Förmåga att arbeta målinriktat och hålla hög kvalitet i ett högt tempo
* Gymnasial utbildning och god IT-vana, särskilt i Excel
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Ett coachande och förebildande ledarskap med hög ansvarskänsla


 Erfarenhet från logistikbranschen och fler språk än svenska/engelska är meriterande.
   

  

**Om Ceva Logistics**
 Ceva Logistics är en global aktör inom logistik och supply chain management med verksamhet i över 170 länder. I Sverige är bolaget starkt växande och satsar stort på att skapa innovativa, hållbara och effektiva lösningar för sina kunder. Läs mer på www.cevalogistics.com.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Ceva med Pokayoke. Tjänsten inleds med en provanställning. Omgående start eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Arbetstider:
   

  

* Dagskift: 06:00–15:00
* Kvällsskift: 15:00–24:00


 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Felicia Pettersson på fep@pokayoke.se.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan redan idag – urval sker löpande!

title: Document Controller- Construction Projects
company_industry: Construction, Civil Engineering, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Company Description**
 At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society. Every day we help our major Pharmaceutical clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects worldwide.
   

  

 Are you interested in working for the world’s leading pharma corporations, delivering their world class, large scale complex projects?
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a Document Controller to work on large construction projects.
   

  

**Responsibiltiies**
* Act as a key interface, maintaining a comprehensive overview of all information and documentation processes.
* Structure and organize efficient end-to-end processes among all stakeholders, including internal departments, external planning teams, and project management.
* Coordinate all project documents, documentation, and manuals.
* Ensure the quality of documents, create master lists, and facilitate the exchange of information and data maintenance.
* Review and update technical documents.


**Qualifications**
* Proven work experience as a Document Controller or similar role
* At least 3 years of practical experience in document management within the construction industry;
* University degree, preferably with a technical background;
* Strong analytical, structural, and organizational abilities;
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the capability to communicate effectively at all levels;
* High affinity for IT, ideally with experience in document management systems;
* Fluent in English and Swedish


**Additional Information**
 Our people share our Purpose and Values. Turner & Townsend provides a great place to work, where everyone can make change happen and influence a better world.
   

  

 We champion our people to succeed in both work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive, and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.
   

  

 Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.
   

  

 Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/
   

  

 Join our social media conversations for more information about Turner & Townsend and our exciting future projects:
   

  

 Twitter
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 LinkedIn

In order to be an authorised Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Turner & Townsend, there must be a formal written agreement in place and the agency must be invited, by the Recruitment Team, to submit candidates for review.*

title: SMB Sales Consultant
description:
**Job Description**
 At NIQ, we set the standard for being the most trusted data partner in the food industry. We did it 100 years ago when we invented the market research industry, and we’re still doing it today. But we don’t stop there. We’re focused on your future, and we know the next big thing can come from anywhere. The business runs offices in 100 countries.
   

  

 We source raw data directly from the grocers and the shoppers themselves, and we turn those digits into useable, measurable, valuable data.
   

  

 Our customers use our products and services to plan their marketing strategies, battle their competition for shelf space in the supermarkets, find opportunities for new products, measure the success of a promo or advertising campaign...
   

  

 In that context, for our Swedish office, we are looking for an SMB Commercial Associate to expand the current team.
   

  

 The SMB Commercial Associate for small & medium FMCG Businesses is a key role in NIQ’s growth strategy. Focused on accelerating organic growth, the NBD generates short-cycle revenue opportunities by contacting leads & prospects, growing business within the own client portfolio and contribute in the longer-cycle revenue processes to win the key prospects not working with NIQ for their insights based on trended sales data.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Own, meet and ‘smash’ the individual revenue target (Forecast and report out of targets and budgets).
* Target new clients via different channels and grow the business within the existing client portfolio assigned with our core retail measurement service, prioritize client visits based on sales potential and build a sustainable external network.
* Identify upselling opportunities
* Execute end-to-end sales process from feasibility analysis; including and pricing, negotiating terms, writing proposals, and closing the sale.
* Monitor progress against revenue target with tenacity and course correct quickly where necessary by making maximum use of the available CRM tools
* Utilize with creativity the tools available within the wider organization to generate leads and build your internal network
* Develop pragmatic engagement plans for the key prospects & clients in your portfolio
* Ensure that all sales materials, including proposals, software- & service demos are consistent and demonstrate best in class within the industry.
* Initiate & Drive projects to bring new product /market combination successfully to the market
* Work with other NIQ departments to ensure alignment and buy-in.
* Develop valuable business issue analyses and category presentations to increase the understanding of NIQ data and insights amongst our Small and Medium sized clients
* Participate actively in building a positive and engaging team culture


 The role is based in our Swedish office. You will report to the Nordics Head of SMB, and will be part of a team of twelve people.
   

  

**About You**
 Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you. You are a high-energy self-starter, curious, passionate about sales, growth, building relationships and new business opportunities. You enjoy contributing to the SMB Team result by having individual impact to make the difference. You are well structured, detail oriented and pro-active. Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. It is key that you are a team-player that can contribute to the dynamic ways we work within NIQ.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Good understanding of the dynamics of the FMCG business
* Minimum 2-3 years of experience, preferably gained in Market Research and or FMCG Trade/Category management
* Familiar with the specs and usage of retail tracking business services within the market
* Skillful in driving client interest and new business through creative proposal- and solution creation resulting in high client satisfaction level.
* Easy connecting with (potential) clients and ability to build and maintain own network among assigned clients & prospects
* Both short-term and long-term results oriented
* Excellent communication skills, ability to read other’s styles and adapt behavior accordingly.
* Fluent in Swedish and Business English Strong Business English knowledge, both verbal and written.
* We expect you to already have experience working with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
* Good presentation and communication skills.
* Microsoft Dynamics and experience with NIQ data is a clear advantage.


 If you have any questions related to the job, please reach out to Thea Nesager, Hiring Manager.
   

  

**Additional Information**
**Our Benefits**
* Flexible working environment
* Volunteer time off
* LinkedIn Learning
* Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


**About NIQ**
 NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.
   

  

 For more information, visit NIQ.com
   

  

 Want to keep up with our latest updates?
   

  

 Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook
   

  

**Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**
 NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

title: Salesforce Application Consultant
description:
**Salesforce Application Consultant** 




**Stockholm, Sweden** 




  





 Join one of the longest-running consulting firms specializing in CRM, CPQ, Data & AI, boasting over 80 employees across multiple countries – with offices in Sweden, Spain, Italy, the Middle East & the US!
 



  





 They specialise in implementing solutions across leading SaaS platforms such as Salesforce, Microsoft, HubSpot, Tacton, and others.
 



  





 My client is excited to hire a
 **Salesforce Application Consultant** 
 to design, develop & maintain scalable CRM solutions, adhering to the SAFe agile framework.

* Analyse business requirements in collaboration with customer to identify needs and translate to CRM functionality.

* Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Salesforce applications as part of a maintenance process with customers.
* Provide expert guidance on Salesforce best practices and industry standards.
* Conduct training sessions and workshops to empower clients and internal teams.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.
* Utilize Agile methodologies, including SAFe, to manage and execute projects efficiently.



  





**Required Qualifications:** 




  




* Minimum 1 years of experience as a Salesforce Application Consultant.
* Experience with one or more: Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, and/or Manufacturing Cloud.
* Relevant Salesforce certifications of the above
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in deliveries.
* Excellent communication skills to effectively interact with clients and team members.



  





**Location:** 



* Stockholm



  





**Language Skills:** 



* Fluent in Swedish



  





 To take the first step in making a great career move, hit the apply button above 😊

title: Konfigurationsledare
description:
Är du en flexibel, men strukturerad och lösningsorienterad person som tycker om att ha koll på helheten, processen och status kring våra leveranser och att vara med och leda framtagningen av försvarssystem?
   

  

 Har du ett intresse av att arbeta med framtagning av framtidens teknik i en innovativ och växande organisation och vill hjälpa till att skapa en tryggare vardag genom att leverera IT-system som fokuserar på samverkan inom Sverige, NATO och dess allierade?
   

  

 Då har vi rätt tjänst för dig!
   

  

**Din nya utmaning**
 Som konfigurationsledare på Mildef kommer du få vara en central del i våra processer och leveranskedjor. I en växande organisation så kommer du få ett ha en stor varians i dina arbetsuppgifter och få möjlighet att sätta din prägel på våra processer och strukturer.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Definiera och implementera konfigurationsledningsprocesser.
* Sätta upp struktur och vara ledare inom ändrandehantering och etablering av CCB.
* Säkerställa versionshantering och etablera baselines av artefakter.
* Packetera och leverera baselines vid leveranstillfällen.
* Säkerställa assurans och spårbarhet mellan våra konfigurationsobjekt.
* Genomföra konfigurationsrevisioner så att våra system och dokumentation överensstämmer.


**Det här bidrar du med**
* Vi ser att du är strukturerad och noggrann och har en stark förmåga att organisera och hantera detaljer, vilket säkerställer att inget faller mellan stolarna.
* Du är analytisk och lösningsorienterad och har en skarp analytisk förmåga och är skicklig på att identifiera problem samt utveckla effektiva lösningar.
* Du är även en utmärkt kommunikatör som trivs med att arbeta i team och kan bygga starka arbetsrelationer.
* Du har en djup förståelse för konfigurationsledning och följer noggrant etablerade processer och regler för att säkerställa kvalitet och konsistens.


 Du måste vara svensk medborgare då tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad. Du talar och skriver flytande på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Varför MilDef?**
 På MilDef får du arbeta i en engagerad och stöttande miljö där dina idéer och insatser värdesätts. Du kommer att ha möjligheter till kontinuerligt lärande och karriärutveckling samt arbeta i en teamorienterad miljö som främjar innovation och samarbete.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
* En engagerande och utvecklande roll i ett ledande företag.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med projekt som bidrar till nationell säkerhet och försvar.
* En samarbetsvillig och stöttande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor.
* Kollektivavtal inkl. bra försäkringar
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Regelbundna hälsoundersökningar
* Happiness team som ordnar roliga aktiviteter


**Ansökan**
 Om du är redo för en ny utmaning och vill bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team, skicka din ansökan snarast. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Läs mer om oss på MilDef.com. För information om tjänsten, kontakta gärna Viktor Attoff, Head of Software Services, på viktor.attoff@mildef.com.
   

  

 Vi påbörjar urvalsprocessen efter ansökningstidens slut den 11 maj.
   

  

***MilDef - WE ARMOR IT.***
*MilDef is a global systems integrator and full-spectrum provider specializing in rugged IT for defense and security domains. MilDef provides hardware, software and services that shield and protect critical information streams and systems, when and where the stakes are the highest.
   

  

 MilDef’s products are sold to more than 200 customers through companies in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, United Kingdom, Germany, Switzerland, the United States and Australia. MilDef was founded in 1997 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2021.*
**We kindly decline contact from advertising and recruitment sales.**

title: Säkerhetschef
description:
Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. Vi är specialister inom stadsutveckling, arkitektur och infrastruktur som bygger samhällen som håller.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 I rollen som Säkerhetschef hos oss på Tyréns kommer du tillhöra
 *Business Support & Business Development* 
 som består av totalt cirka 80 personer, specialiserade inom områdena IT, juridik, HR & Payroll, Marknad & Kommunikation, Hållbarhet & Kvalitet, Säkerhet, Fastighet & Kontor samt Strategy & Project Office. Vi arbetar alla både strategiskt och operativt, med förvaltning och utveckling, samt stöd och rådgivning med syftet att bidra till att förverkliga Tyréns affär:
 *Jobba med samhällsbyggnad med målet att skapa bättre förutsättningar för dagens och framtidens städer.*
 Du rapporterar till Head of Business Support & Business Development och ingår i dennes ledningsgrupp. Tjänsten är placerad på Tyréns huvudkontor på Södermalm, Stockholm. Resor förekommer inom Sverige och till andra länder inom koncernen.
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du exempelvis jobba med att:
   

  

* Ansvara operativt och strategisk för vårt säkerhetsarbete vilket innefattar säkerhetsskydd, fysisk säkerhet, informationssäkerhet och personalsäkerhet
* Ingå i krisledningsgruppen samt bidra i samband med visselblåsning
* Arbeta med tillämpningen av säkerhetsskyddslagen och du arbetar aktivt för att utveckla, skapa förutsättningar för och sprida en god säkerhetskultur på Tyréns


 Du kommer arbeta strategisk och operativt nära verksamheten i bland annat våra anbud och uppdrag. I kontakt med kund kommer du agera stöd och rådgivare för tillämpning av gällande lagstiftning. Som Säkerhetschef har du kontinuerlig och nära dialog internt med bl a kvalitetschef, IT-chef och kontorschefer och till stöd i arbetet har du säkerhetssamordnare och resurser i samband med säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
* Fantastiska kollegor och många specialister inom våra olika kompetensområden.
* En värderingsdriven kultur där Connect, Create & Challenge är våra ledord.
* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö i våra lokaler med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån del av din arbetstid.
* Möjlighet att jobba med innovationsprojekt.
* Kompetensutveckling anpassad efter dig.
* Sociala aktiviteter, både på och efter ordinarie arbetstid.
* Extra lediga dagar utöver dina semesterdagar, vi är t.ex. alltid lediga med lön dagarna mellan jul och nyår.
* Flertalet personalförmåner via vår förmånsportal.
* Kollektivavtal som vi tecknat med Innovationsföretagen (Almega).


 Klicka här för att läsa mer om oss, vilken typ av projekt vi jobbar med, vilka utvecklingsmöjligheter som finns, våra innovationer, läsa bloggar och lyssna på våra medarbetares podcasts.
   

  

**Vi söker**
 För att lyckas och trivas i rollen bör du ha:
   

  

* Högskole– eller universitetsutbildning alternativt längre relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet i en ansvarig befattning där du arbetat operativt och strategisk med säkerhetsskydd och fysisk skydd
* Praktisk erfarenhet av tillämpning av lagstiftningen om säkerhetsskyddad upphandling


 Meriterande är erfarenhet/kunskap inom:
   

  

* Informationssäkerhet, personalsäkerhet samt IT säkerhet


 Personliga egenskaper vi tror passar rollen och vår företagskultur:
   

  

* Drivande och kan gå från ord till handling på ett strukturerat och självständigt sätt
* Kommunikativ förmåga där du förstår kundens behov och är lyhörd för verksamheten
* Affärsmässig ledare som på ett innovativt och lösningsorienterat sätt driver det långsiktiga strategiska arbetet och samtidigt tar dig an den verksamhetsnära/operativa rollen
* Det är viktigt att du även förstår vikten av att arbeta värderingsstyrt och delar Tyréns värdegrund, ”Create, Challenge & Connect”


 För denna tjänst ser vi att du hanterar det svenska och engelska språket i både tal och skrift för att kunna tillmötesgå våra kunder och kollegors behov.
   

  

 Som Säkerhetschef är du placerad i säkerhetsklass varför godkänd säkerhetsprövning är ett krav. I den här rekryteringen kommer även bakgrundskontroll och tester ingå i processen.
   

  

**Ansöka**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Level Recruitment. Vi ber er därför att ansöka via deras annons som du når genom att klicka här.
   

  

 Personligt brev är inte ett krav hos oss, men kommer naturligtvis läsas om det bifogas.
   

  

 Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka gärna din ansökan redan idag då tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Med hänvisning till GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar per mejl utan hanterar enbart ansökningar som kommer in via ansökningslänken.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten eller har frågor? Då är du välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

 Sissel Strand
   

  

 Senior Rekryteringskonsult, Level recruitment
   

  

 Mejl: sissel.strand@levelrecruitment.se
   

  

 Telefon: 08-120 50 426
   

  

 Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. I samspel med kunder och partners skapar vi hållbara lösningar inom stadsutveckling och infrastruktur. Tyrénskoncernen har 3 000 medarbetare med verksamhet i Sverige, Storbritannien, Estland, Litauen, Polen, Bulgarien och Kanada. Tyréns är stiftelseägt och vår ägandeform gör det möjligt för oss att satsa målmedvetet på forskning och innovation inom samhällsbyggnadsområdet. Vi drivs av nyfikenhet och har ett nära samarbete med universitet och högskolor.
   

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

 Tillbaka

title: HR Generalist
description:
Auctionet is a marketplace where auction houses from Sweden, the UK, Finland, Spain, Germany, and Denmark sell furniture, art, design items, collectibles, and more. We are now in search of our first
 **HR Generalist for our People team** 
 .
   

  

**About The Role**
 As our HR Generalist, you’ll take on a wide-ranging and varied role, working hands-on across all areas of HR. You’ll support managers across the organization while helping us improve how we do things step by step.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Working closely with the Chief People Officer, supporting everything from HR administration to developing new ways of working.
* Ensuring our managers and employees use our HR system (Hailey HR) effectively, and driving its development.
* Developing our onboarding and offboarding processes.
* Supporting our recruitment processes – from role profile to signed contract.
* Supporting with employment contracts across the group and handling HR administration.
* Helping us remain a workplace where people thrive, grow, and want to stay.
* Supporting our Payroll Administrator in securing the accuracy of all payroll and benefit processes.
* Maintaining structure for documentation, templates, and contracts, and making sure everything is updated.


 We aim to improve by 1% every day, and you’ll play a central role in building smart and effective solutions in a fast-paced company where we aim to be the best Employer and People team.
   

  

**About The Team**
 We’re a small but mighty People team of three, fueled by heart, curiosity, and a healthy dose of freedom under responsibility. As a fairly new function in the company, we’re in build-mode – which means there’s tons of room for ideas, creativity, and shaping how we do HR. We also value the importance of having fun at work, because good vibes lead to great results!
   

  

 Auctionet has around 170 employees and is the parent company of a wider group with approximately 400 colleagues across multiple countries.
   

  

**About You**
 You’re someone who’s curious, structured, and eager to learn – someone who enjoys creating order, but doesn’t mind when things shift or evolve. You’re motivated by being part of something growing and changing, and you see opportunities where others might see uncertainty.
   

  

 You like to take initiative, enjoy collaborating with others, and believe HR plays a key role in how a company thrives. Most importantly, you're excited to roll up your sleeves and contribute, while continuing to grow in your own HR journey.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, we think you have:
   

  

* An education in Human Resources or a similar field.
* Some practical experience in recruitment and/or HR administration.
* Full proficiency in both Swedish and English, written and spoken – this is essential for daily communication.
* Bonus and not mandatory: Experience working with collective agreements and/or HR systems.


 This role is based on-site at our office in central Stockholm, with the possibility to work remotely one day per week.
   

  

 Our Recruitment Process
   

  

 We have a straightforward process without unpleasant surprises.
   

  

 We'll start of with a short phone interview and greet just to get a feeling if we could be right for each other or not.
   

  

 We then have a few meetings (usually two or three) where we talk about you, the role and Auctionet - and you get the chance to talk to the people you will work closely with. In the process, we will also ask you to do a small take-home exercise. And in the end, we hope it feels like the perfect fit for both of us!
   

  

 Apply By
   

  

 We will be reviewing applications continuously, but please submit your application no later than 2025-05-30.
   

  

 Who We Are
   

  

 Auctionet was founded in 2011 by a team of people with unique experience of online auctions. Read more about Auctionet here.
   

  

 In 2021 Auctionet acquired the auction house Stockholms Auktionsverk, and we are now by far the largest auction marketplace in the Nordics, and one of the larger auction marketplaces in the world. With this acquisition, Auctionet owns and operates both the oldest auction house in the world (1674) and the second oldest (1681), which means we have been working with sustainability for 350(!) years.
   

  

 Join us in our vision to make valued objects accessible for everyone, from everywhere!

title: Partner Management Senior Specialist
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**We help the world run better**
 At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.
   

  

 As a Partner Business Manager for SAP Sweden, you are responsible for promoting our entire product portfolio through a team of partners. You are the single point of contact for all sales opportunities that have a partner component, both internally and externally. You are the face of SAP and accountable for building and maintaining the relationship with our partners. This position reports to the Nordic head of Partner and Alliances and will be located in our SAP office in Stockholm.
   

  

 To work directly with the sales team and be responsible for the managing of partner relationships and to drive pipeline and revenue sales, will also be your work duties. Additional important tasks are to create awareness for company products amongst assigned team of partners, coordinate training, consulting and joint development activities and to coordinate effective marketing programs within partner channels. You Plans and executes Go-To-Market activities within the market unit for the holistic SAP Portfolio: Builds & executes on annual operational plans to support revenue targets (stakeholder & portfolio coverage, enablement & alignment with key industries & sales teams, marketing plans on country level, etc.). Investigate and initiate product initiatives and business plans, in order to take advantage of market opportunities, including establishment of new offerings or entering new markets together with the Line of Businesses.
   

  

 You act as an SAP ambassador and represent SAP in industry associations and events. To be successful you are a natural networker and influencer, have previous experience in partner driven sales in a cloud software company, you are a problem solver that love challenges and is a trusted partner to the business. You are a team player, have an “eager to develop” mindset and can easily adapt and navigate in large matrix organizations.
   

  

**Education And Qualifications / Skills And Competencies**
* Degree in Business Administration, Engineering or Computer Science or in related discipline preferred
* Good sales or business development/demand generation experience
* Act strong and secure with senior management executives
* Good understanding of how to create value through partnering and how to successfully execute on alliances.
* Familiar with SAP, its products and solutions, partners, markets and competition.
* Business experience, preferably with a major high technology corporation or strategic consulting firm to forge initiatives and go-to-market plans with partners
* High impact interpersonal, networking, presentation and communication skills
* Excellent knowledge of English and Swedish.


**Work Experience**
* 4+ years working experience in the software industry
* 3+ years in a customer or partner facing role (ex. Customer Service, Sales, Consulting)
* Experience of working in a large matrix organization


**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
   

  

 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
   

  

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability**
 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
   

  

 Requisition ID: 422278 | Work Area: Sales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: .

title: RISE with SAP Chief Enterprise Architect
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**We help the world run better**
 At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.
   

  

**Meet Your Team**
 Join our dynamic SAP Enterprise Architects team within the new SAP Customer Services & Delivery board. We lead digital transformation using cutting-edge SAP technologies, advancing the RISE with SAP initiative, promoting Clean Core principles, and accelerating SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) adoption. Our mission is to simplify and modernize IT landscapes, reducing complexity and operational costs, while fostering innovation and efficiency to support evolving business needs.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Chief Enterprise Architect, you will develop a comprehensive enterprise architecture model for our customers aligning with their enterprise goals, collaborate with virtual account teams (VAT) as a transformation partner and lead activities such as:
   

  

* Guide customers through their cloud journey (with special focus on adopt and derive), starting with Enterprise archetypes and scaling digitally.
* Provide enterprise architecture guidance using RISE with SAP methodology and Clean Core principles to ensure that every customer benefits from SAP‘s cloud qualities.
* Act as the Transformation Partner for the CIO or other CxO, driving architecture effectiveness.
* Support adoption, identifying and mitigating technical adoption risks.
* Align customers and partners with SAP’s Clean Core strategy, accelerate BTP adoption and promote SAP best practices.
* Provide customer context to all teams, enhancing customer proximity and experience.
* Articulate the value of the designed target architecture and possible intermediate/ transition steps as well as provide guidance on the realization of the identified benefits
* Serve as a trusted advisor, ensuring secure, reliable, and flexible cloud environments for mission-critical processes.


**What You Bring**
 Transformation, Architectural & Solution Skills:
   

  

* Extensive Experience delivering enterprise business transformation projects and aligning customer priorities with target architecture and roadmap.
* In-depth knowledge of the SAP Solution Portfolio and Enterprise Architecture Framework (North Star).
* Experience with Business Technology Platform components (application development, automation, data and analytics, integration, AI) and practical experience with S/4HANA applications.
* Strong understanding of Cloud & Clean Core Strategy, familiarity with SAP LeanIX, Signavio, and Cloud ALM.
* Knowledge of SAP's Business AI roadmap, including identifying use cases and piloting AI-driven solutions to enhance business processes.
* Expertise in SAP Integration and Extensibility Advisory Methodologies.


**Must-Have Requirements**
* 15+ years in customer experience roles (e.g., Program Manager, Architect), with experience in end-to-end architectural design for hybrid solution landscapes.
* Extensive knowledge of SAP Enterprise Architecture Framework and Toolset, and experience with BTP components and services such as application development, automation, data and analytics, integration, and AI capabilities.
* S/4HANA technical or/and SAP S/4HANA application/functional knowledge/experience.
* Proficiency in SAP Integration and Extensibility Advisory Methodologies and Clean Core principles.
* Excellent communication, influencing, and negotiation skills (in English) at the senior management and C-levels, both within an IT team and across business functions.
* Mindset for Strategic Thinking, Continuous Learning, and Business Acumen.
* Knowledge of on-premise and corresponding SAP cloud solutions.
* Professional training and certification (e.g., SAP Enterprise Architecture Framework featured by LeanIX EAM, SAP Certified Professional-Enterprise Architect [P\_SAPEA\_2023], TOGAF.


**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
   

  

 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.

title: ServiceNow GRC konsult
description:
*Är du en skicklig och ambitiös konsult med erfarenhet av risk- och säkerhetshantering? Har du en passion för teknik och vill hjälpa till att leverera innovativa lösningar via ServiceNow-plattformen? Då vill vi att du ska bli en del av teamet!*
 \_ \_ \_ \_
   

  

**Om oss**
 Risk & Compliance Consulting (RCC) på KPMG Advisory är ett mångsidigt team på cirka 60 kollegor med ämnes expertis inom risktransformation, regelefterlevnad, forensiska utredningar och hantering av bedrägeririsker, intern kontroll, riskhantering, internrevision och hållbarhet. Vi arbetar med ett brett spektrum av riskrådgivningstjänster och våra medarbetare har mycket olika bakgrunder, inklusive ekonomi, juridik, teknik, företagsekonomi och statsvetenskap.
   

  

 Vår mångfald i både människor och kompetenser gör oss till en ledande rådgivare på marknaden. Vi arbetar med högpresterande kunder inom alla sektorer, inklusive privat sektor, offentlig sektor och finansiella tjänster. En viktig del av vårt arbete är digitalisering och integrering av ny teknik för att förändra riskhanterings- och efterlevnadsprocesser för våra kunder. Vi ger råd till våra kunder i deras transformationsresor och främjar digitala, innovativa och hållbara lösningar på våra kunders affärsutmaningar.
   

  

 Vi hjälper våra kunder med rådgivning och implementering av den ledande teknikplattformen ServiceNow, för digitalisering och transformation inom våra discipliner. Våra verksamhetsområden inkluderar riskhantering, säkerhet, supply chain, HR, portföljhantering, leverantörsstyrning och utveckling av kundspecifika lösningar.
   

  

 KPMGs ServiceNow satsning är en global framgångssaga och vårt fokus på professionell expertis och domänexpertis har gjort oss till en föredragen partner, både för ServiceNow och för våra kunder. Våra insatser har uppmärksammats globalt genom att bland annat ha utsetts till ServiceNow Global Transformation Partner of the Year 2023.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Vi söker dig som har, eller vill bygga, kompetens inom riskhantering, cybersäkerhet, regelefterlevnad, bolagsstyrning samt krisberedskap och integritet – ur ett teknik- och verktygsstödsperspektiv. Det finns mycket utrymme att växa professionellt och personligt i denna position!
   

  

 Som ServiceNow GRC konsult kommer du att;
   

  

* Spela en nyckelroll i att hjälpa våra kunder att stärka sin GRC-funktion (Governance, Risk, and Compliance) med hjälp av ServiceNow plattformen
* Vara involverad i olika kundengagemang inom olika branscher
* Vägleda och hjälpa kunder med råd om implementering och användning av ServiceNow inom primärt Governance Risk and Compliance
* Bidra till att utforma och anpassa lösningar som adresserar kundens behov inom risk- och säkerhetshantering, regelefterlevnad, leverantörsrisk, nödberedskap och integritet
* Samarbeta med multidisciplinära team för att säkerställa leveranser av hög kvalitet
* Vara en drivande kraft för bästa praxis och ständiga förbättringar
* Aktivt delta i utvecklingen av tjänsteområdet inom ServiceNow med innovativa lösningar på komplexa problem, och inte minst hjälpa till att bygga ett starkt cyber- och GRC-community i hela Norden och EMA


 ,
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Masterexamen inom teknik, ekonomi, IT-säkerhet, samhällssäkerhet och riskhantering eller motsvarande
* 2-6 års erfarenhet inom relevanta områden som risk- och säkerhetshantering, IT-styrning eller compliance
* Praktisk erfarenhet av GRC-verktyg, särskilt ServiceNow
* God teknisk förståelse och intresse för hur teknik kan stödja affärsprocesser
* Stark kommunikationsförmåga, både på svenska och engelska


**Vill du göra skillnad med oss?**
 Vänta inte med din ansökan eftersom vi granskar ansökningar och anställer löpande. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten, tveka inte att kontakta rekryterande chef Emil Lundvall, emil.lundvall@kpmg.se. För eventuella frågor relaterade till rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Talent Acquisition Partner, Marie-Louise Bååth, marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och för nya kollegor att haka på vår resa!**
- 

 I den här rekryteringen har vi följande steg;
   

  

* Verksamhetsintervju
* Personlighet- och logisk test med personlighetsintervju
* Slutintervju
* Referenser
* Bakgrundskontroll

title: Business Director
company_industry: Advertising Services, Marketing Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Business Director to EssenceMediacom**
 We are currently seeking an experienced and visionary Business Director for our marketing agency. This key role focuses on driving new business growth, expanding our existing client relationships, and leading and developing a high-performing team. The ideal candidate has over 10 years of experience in a media agency or consulting firm and demonstrates outstanding drive, commitment, and a proven track record in client relations, business development, and team leadership.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Business Development:**
* Identify and drive new business opportunities by leveraging market insights and industry trends.
* Build and nurture strong relationships with prospective clients to understand their needs and highlight the agency's unique value.
* Create and deliver strategic presentations and commercial proposals to attract potential clients.


**Client Relationship Development:**
* Oversee and strengthen relationships with existing clients by aligning media strategies with their evolving needs.
* Regularly review client campaigns and provide strategic insights and recommendations for improvements.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for key clients, fostering long-term, trust-based partnerships.


**Team Leadership and Personnel Management:**
* Lead, guide, and develop the client team, focusing on both individual and team growth.
* Foster a culture of continuous learning, professional development, and excellence within the team.
* Implement effective team structures and processes to ensure efficient client service and career development opportunities for employees.
* Regularly assess and address the team’s training and career development needs in alignment with the agency’s strategic goals.


**Strategic Planning and Execution:**
* Contribute to the agency’s strategic planning with a focus on driving clients' overall business objectives.
* Monitor industry trends and competitor activities and adapt strategies to maintain competitive advantages.
* Ensure the use of innovative and effective media solutions in client campaigns.


**Qualifications And Experience**
* At least 10 years of experience in a media agency or consulting firm with a proven track record in growth-driven business development and team leadership.
* Strong leadership skills and experience in personnel management and team development.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships.
* Strategic and analytical thinking, capable of solving complex problems.
* Deep understanding of media planning, media buying, and digital strategies.
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, advertising, communication, or a related field. Advanced degrees or professional certifications are an advantage.


**Personal Attributes**
* Highly driven and engaged, with a passion for media, client success, and team development.
* Creative and innovative thinker who continuously seeks ways to improve services and enhance client satisfaction.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills, capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously.
* Adaptable and flexible, thriving in a fast-paced and evolving industry.


**What We Offer**
* A dynamic, collaborative work environment with a team of dedicated professionals.
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.


 The Business Director will play a crucial role in shaping the agency’s future, driving growth, ensuring the highest level of service for our clients, and fostering an environment where team members can thrive and succeed. If you are a motivated leader with a passion for media, client success, and talent development, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

**About EssenceMediacom**
 We are a leading global marketing and media agency and a part of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company. EssenceMediacom combines creativity, innovation, and data-driven strategy to help brands achieve their business goals and build strong connections with their target audiences. With expertise in marketing strategy, media planning, buying, and media optimization, the agency delivers tailored solutions that generate measurable results.
   

  

 As part of GroupM, EssenceMediacom has access to an extensive network and resources, making it a strategic partner for companies aiming to stay ahead in an ever-changing marketing landscape.
   

  

 EssenceMediacom has offices in Stockholm and Gothenburg and fosters a culture built on the belief that everything begins and ends with people. We take pride in working with exciting brands such as Tele2, Klarna, Byggmax, adidas, Kjell & Company, Coca-Cola, Bayer, and Google.
   

  

**Application**
 Selections are made continuously, so please upload your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions, feel free to contact Morten Flamand, CEO at EssenceMediacom, at morten.flamand@essencemediacom.com.
