title: Emerging Market Account Manager
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 Are you ready to make an impact in growing markets and work with dynamic teams across the globe? We’re looking for an
 **Emerging Market Account Manager** 
 to drive business development, foster strong relationships, and lead scalable sales channels in diverse and exciting markets.
   

  

 This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden (with a hybrid model) or remotely from Poland.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
**Account Management & Stakeholder Engagement:**
* Build and maintain strong relationships with sales partners, key opinion leaders, and industry associations.
* Collaborate with internal teams to provide tools, training, and resources for partner success.
* Manage incoming leads, ensuring timely and effective follow-ups.


**Business Development:**
* Develop and grow scalable sales channels and market infrastructure.
* Represent Tobii Dynavox at industry events to strengthen market presence.
* Expand markets to their potential and prepare them for handover to regional teams.


**Sales, Forecasting, & Strategy:**
* Achieve or exceed revenue targets.
* Deliver data-driven insights to inform strategies and forecasts.
* Contribute to accurate planning for assigned markets.


**What We’re Looking For:**
* Bachelor’s degree in business, technology, special education, healthcare, or related fields.
* 2-4 years of experience in international sales, preferably in tech or medical devices.
* Fluent in English and proficient in Polish or another Slavic language. Additional languages are a plus.
* Willingness to travel internationally to support market activities.
* Growth mindset with an analytical approach to problem-solving.


**We also believe you have:**
* A strong business development and negotiation skills.
* An entrepreneurial mindset with excellent cross-cultural communication.
* Proficiency in financial acumen, networking, and organization.
* International experience with a knack for cross-functional cooperation.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Principal Enterprise Account Manager, AWS Enterprise Sales
description:
***This job is with Amazon, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Description**
 Would you like to be part of a team focused on increasing adoption of Amazon Web Services by developing enterprise accounts? Do you have the business savvy and the technical background necessary to help establish Amazon as a key technology platform provider?
   

  

 As an Enterprise Account Manager you will have the exciting opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of an emerging technology. Your responsibilities will include driving revenue, adoption, and market penetration in enterprise accounts. The ideal candidate will possess both a sales and technical background that enables them to drive an engagement at the CXO level as well as with software developers and IT architects. You should also be a self-starter who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver on annual revenue targets.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Drive revenue and market share in a defined territory or industry vertical
* Meet or exceed annual revenue targets
* Develop and execute against a comprehensive account/territory plan
* Create & articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services
* Accelerate customer adoption
* Maintain a robust sales pipeline
* Work with extended teams and partners to extend reach & drive adoption
* Manage contract negotiations
* Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
* Ensure customer satisfaction
* Expect moderate travel


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Extensive experience as a quota carrying technology field sales individual and Extensive experience working with large Enterprises
* Proven track record selling transformational projects and solutions and experience increasing technology adoption and creating long term transformational account strategies
* Experience working with and presenting to C-level executives, IT, and other lines of business
* Demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise Customers


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience developing, negotiating and executing business agreements experience
* Experience in one or more of the following industry sectors: Retail, M&E, Industrial/Manufacturing, Energy, Mining, Security, Financial Services
* Direct experience in customer-facing role interacting with multinational customer organizations.
* Understanding of Cloud Services and Content delivery
* Deep experience in satellite communications technologies and value adds


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you're applying in isn't listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Product Sales Specialist
description:
**Do you have a strong interest in IT products, and are you good at capturing customers' interest with relevant product information and enjoy working independently in a high-performing team?**
 As our new Product Sales Specialist in one of our category teams , you will play an important role in our work to enable customers to find the right products to match their needs and convert them to buy but also ensure Dustin continues a successful collaboration with the customers over time. You will get the autonomy to influence our product range and future offerings through your expertise and work in the product team.
   

  

 Recruiting manager for this position is Daniel Karlsson. His leadership can be described as straight forward where freedom with responsibility is key. He loves to see people grow and uses a coaching mindset to develop the team. She also thinks curiosity to try new things brings you and the team forward.
   

  

**What Does a Product Sales Specialist Do At Dustin**
 As a Product Sales Specialist, you will be given a central role in our organization and will work closely with other specialists, product managers, and the e-com and purchasing organisations. You get the opportunity to create, maintain and develop the range of products in the category in an e-com setting, as well as:
   

  

* Handle masterdata at product level for all our markets
* Link relevant accessories to drive attach sales
* Create search engine optimization (SEO) of our product content to drive traffic and inspire our customers to buy our products
* Create Dustin content with help of AI tools
* Contact with suppliers and manufacturers about products and content
* Together with other departments ensure a smooth and inspiring online purchase journey
* Be an active advisor on product-related issues for all Dustin’s operating countries


 You are given continuous opportunities for development and will have a knowledgeable team around you. They all strive for a friendly and supportive culture and enjoy sharing their knowledge, reaching common goals, and connecting over a Fika.
   

  

**This Is What You’ll Get**
 We believe we offer so much more than what benefits on a list can say. But you won’t know that until you join us. So, we will still want to list a few:
   

  

* 20% discount on memberships at SATS and an annual wellness allowance
* A one-time home office allowance of 3500 to buy home office equipment
* Collective Agreement, including good pension plans, parental pay, and insurance
* Employee discount for products through our Dustin web shop
* A flexible work life where we embrace the mix of working digitally and from the office
* Bring your dog! – we have an office area specifically for you and your best friend


**What You Bring**
 We will ensure a thorough onboarding in the role, and most can be learned if you have the interest and passion to work with products. To be successful in this role, we believe you have the following:
   

  

* Experience working in an international matrix organization
* Prior roles with back office or knowledge of back-office systems
* Appreciate a developing and growing system and working environment and evolve with it.
* An interest in Tech and IT
* Good collaboration skills and team spirit to win as a team
* Comfortability writing content in English and collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders in English


 We Believe Our Colleagues Are The Key Reason For Our Positive Development. And We Believe Our Development Is What Gives You The Possibility To Grow. That Is Why We Can Promise You One Thing
   

  

**You keep us moving. We keep you moving.**
****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* 1st interview with Manager System Support & Product Creation Daniel Karlsson
* Personality and cognitive assessment
* 2nd interview with Daniel Karlsson & team member


 For questions about the position, please contact Daniel via e-mail: daniel.karlsson@dustin.com

title: Finance Business Partner B2C Finland (Location Stockholm)
description:
Finance Business Partner B2C – Finland
   

  

*Want to be part of a company expanding and improving connectivity across the Nordics?*
*GlobalConnect is on a growth journey, and we’re now looking for a Finance Business Partner to support us and boost our operations in Finland. If that sounds like something for you, keep reading – this might just be your next step!*
 As our Finance Business Partner for B2C Finland, you’ll have a central role in supporting strategic financial decisions and enabling us to ensure sustainable growth in this promising market. Finland is a key area for GlobalConnect, with significant investments underway, and you will work closely with the Finnish leadership team to provide insights and financial guidance.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll ensure transparency and accuracy in financial processes, build robust forecasting models, and present clear data that informs major business decisions. Whether it’s monitoring investments, analyzing trends, or preparing high-quality presentations, your work will directly support Finland’s growth from a start-up market to a cornerstone of our operations.
   

  

 You'll also collaborate with an international team of senior finance professionals across the Nordics, bringing together your innovative thinking and attention to financial detail.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
* Build and maintain financial revenue forecasting models and reports.
* Oversee monthly results, revenue, cost bookings, and cashflow follow-ups.
* Provide accurate budgeting and deviation analyses to support strategic decisions.
* Develop clear and engaging presentations of financial data for internal stakeholders.
* Monitor investments and CAPEX for key projects in Finland.


**Why GlobalConnect?**
 At GlobalConnect, we’re on a growth journey, and Finland is crucial to this expansion, with 25% of our total company investments directed here. In this role, you'll have the chance to play a significant part in one of our most important markets, collaborating with committed leaders and colleagues who value innovation and strategic thinking.
   

  

**To perform well in this role, we think you have:**
* Solid experience in finance business partnering, particularly in a vibrant environment.
* Documented history with revenue models and budgeting, with a strong Excel skillset.
* Familiarity with local financial laws and fluency in English, with additional Finnish or Swedish fluency.
* Experience from consultancy work would be beneficial but it’s not a requirement.


**The Team & Setup**
 You’ll report directly to our Vice President of B2C Finance, working alongside highly experienced colleagues from Sweden, Denmark, and Norway. The role is hybrid, with a flexible arrangement of three days per week on-site in either Helsinki or Stockholm. Occasional travel between these locations will keep your work varied and engaging.
   

  

*No need for a personal letter unless you want to highlight something beyond your resume or LinkedIn profile.*
 We look forward to your application!

title: Territory Sales Manager, Surgical Technologies | Greater Stockholm & North of Sweden
company_industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Medical Equipment Manufacturing
description:
**The Job’s Mission:**
 As
 **Territory Sales Manager** 
 , you will help us deliver on our mission of making healthcare better by promoting and selling Stryker’s
 **Surgical Technologies** 
 product portfolio. On average,
 **most of your time in this position will be in the Greater Stockholm area (60-70%)** 
 . The other portion of your time will be covering the
 **North of Sweden** 
 .
   

  

 In this role, you will pursue opportunities to grow our Surgical Technologies business, while demonstrating exemplary customer and patient focus.
 **This is a great opportunity to join one of the world’s leading medical technology organizations, make an impact, grow and develop further** 
 !
   

  

**About Stryker Surgical Technologies:**
 Stryker’s Surgical Technologies business focus on improving the safety of healthcare professionals and their patients while also helping hospitals reduce their ecological footprint. Some examples of our innovative portfolio are:
   

  

* SafeAir: Studies indicate that nurses have twice the incidence of respiratory problems compared with the general population – and inhale an equivalent of 27 cigarettes in an 8-hour day in the operating room. Stryker’s SafeAir products help to reduce the exposure of healthcare professionals and their patients to surgical smoke (and its chemical, carcinogenic hazards). Find out more about SafeAir: https://www.safeor.com/products/smokeevacuation
* Neptune collects, transports and disposes of surgical waste fluid helping protect healthcare professionals from exposure whilst increasing efficiencies in the operating room. Find out more about Neptune: https://www.safeor.com/products/neptune and https://www.safeor.com/products/neptune-s
* Hear the story of Julie Greenhalgh and the impact of our solutions to healthcare professionals in the operating room: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZZeFzYpXots


**What you will do:**
* In your new role, you will start with a familiarization phase with product trainings to learn about our product portfolio and develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
* Prospect new customers, understand their needs, while also providing ongoing service to existing customers: fostering trust relationships and customer loyalty.
* Plan and implement strategies in the sales process and conduct negotiations including with hospital professionals, purchasing departments, etc.
* With the product knowledge you’ll develop, you will inform, advise and train hospital professionals also during demonstrations.
* Prepare orders for interested customers and be a reliable partner for our customers also during order follow-up and after-sales.
* Participate congresses, seminars and business meetings to identify potential new customers and to expand your knowledge for customer contact.
* Work closely with Surgical Technologies team members and also with peers of other divisions of Stryker towards cross-departmental opportunities.


**What you need:**
 Required:
   

  

* 4+ years of experience.
* Degree or equivalent.
* Excellent interpersonal communications and persuasion skills – with proficiency in Swedish and English.
* Relationship skills: you appreciate contact with a wide variety of people and enjoy building and maintaining connections. You also consider yourself a great team player.
* You are enthusiastic about (medical) technology – your resilience and desire to sell technical products with the best customer service are important elements to you.
* You demonstrate adaptability, organizational and analytical skills.
* You have a valid driver’s license as this position involves regular customer visits.


 Preferred:
   

  

* Sales experience with capital devices/equipment is not mandatory, but it would be an advantage.
* Sales experience in industries such as MedTech, BioTech, healthcare or related is not mandatory, but it would be a plus.


**What we offer:**
* Flat hierarchies and a culture committed to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results.
* We grow talent: we offer great personal and internal career development for our employees, with the possibility to make both vertical and lateral position movement.
* An attractive salary and benefits package including company car, an attractive pension plan, etc.
* Recognition of your performance: at Stryker, outstanding individual and cross-functional team performance is rewarded. Ideas, projects, or other exceptional achievements can be submitted for various awards on a local and global level.
* Collaborative and inclusive environment: join a team that values diversity and inclusion, fostering a supportive and innovative workplace.
* Quality products that improve the lives of our customers and patients.
* Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your career.


 Stryker is a global leader in medical technologies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in MedSurg, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 150 million patients annually.

title: Sales Representative -Stockholm
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Brooks, we believe movement is the key to feeling more alive. That’s why we’re driven to create gear and experiences that take people to the place that makes them feel more alive — whether it’s a headspace, a feeling, or a finish line.
   

  

 Everyone who works at Brooks is propelled by a company culture that sparks excitement, fuels collaboration, inspires creativity, and ignites innovation.
   

  

 Our brand values help bond us together and drive our success:
   

  

* Runner First


 We act in the best interest of the runner
   

  

* Word is Bond


 We do what we say we’ll do
   

  

* Champion Heart


 We give our all in everything we do
   

  

* There is no “I” in Run


 We stay generous with our humanity
   

  

* Keep Moving


 We find ways to move every day, because joy is kinetic!
   

  

 We welcome everyone from every walk of life looking to inspire others through the power of movement — because we’re all moving towards something. Let’s run there.
   

  

**Your Job**
 The Sales Representative, Sweden is responsible for driving Brooks product sales revenue and margin within their respective territory. You manage all aspects of Brooks’ sales of footwear, apparel and accessories including sell-in and sell-through and define sales goals and marketing strategies for Sweden. You will also lead and execute the field support strategy to increase market share, amplify Brooks’ product leadership, and create recognition, awareness and loyalty for the brand.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Meet yearly revenue plans for footwear, apparel and accessories for your assigned territory.
* Identify market potential for current database to increase number of accounts accordingly in the upcoming seasons.
* Enter all future booking orders through Brooks’ proprietary web-based tools, ensure the at once order flow during the season.
* Be the expert on your territory, provide field feedback on competitor’s products, program and services as well as marketplace activities.
* Work with territory accounts to forecast, develop and implement yearly plans around their footwear and apparel needs in order to grow Brooks’ market share.
* Provide analysis and feedback on sell-through & market share data both to Brooks’ business and retailers.
* Collaborate with EMEA Marketing to develop and implement full year marketing plans to grow revenue, brand awareness and market share.
* Manage and support the retailers and ensure alignment on revenue and marketing plans for the territory.
* Lead the overall field support efforts for Brooks at both Specialty Running Accounts (SRA) and Non-Specialty accounts located within the territory: product launches, in-store merchandising, and innovative grassroots programs at all accounts.
* Educate and motivate the retailer, consumer, and all key points of contact about Brooks technology and product leadership via product seminars, clinics and events.
* Provide field feedback on competitor’s products, program and services as well as marketplace activities; identify new opportunities for growth within or outside the running industry.
* Work with territory accounts to forecast, develop and implement yearly plans around their footwear and apparel needs in order to grow Brooks’ market share.
* Maintain appearance of leased company vehicle and all Brooks equipment.
* Travel required to tradeshows, bi-annual sales meetings, expos and Brooks offsite meetings.


**Your Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Sales, Business Management, Marketing or related field desirable
* 3+ years’ footwear and apparel sales experience.
* Specialty retail (running) experience of at least one year required.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in Swedish and business English.
* Excellent interpersonal skills that inspire and build trust resulting in effective working relationships across the company.
* Keen attention to detail in planning, organization and execution of tasks, while still seeing the big picture and understanding how all of the pieces fit together and affect one another.
* Demonstration of innovation and initiative – always looking at improving our products and processes while also displaying a willingness to dive into the details and help out wherever necessary.
* Knowledge of performance athletic footwear/apparel/accessories and their related technologies.
* Knowledge of the biomechanics of human motion; understanding of injury prevention basics
* 70% travel is required.
* General computer proficiency in Microsoft Office products - Excel, Word, PowerPoint
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to listen and understand customer needs.
* Ability to provide analysis and feedback on sell through both to Brooks’ corporate and accounts.
* Embraces and lives the Brooks values!


 Brooks Sports is an equal opportunity employer and our policy is to maintain employment practices that conform to the intent and letter of the laws regarding equal employment opportunity. title: Speciallärare i svenska till Nacka gymnasium
description:
Nacka gymnasium är en stor och attraktiv gymnasieskola med ett centralt läge tio minuter från Slussen och promenadavstånd till Nacka Forum. Skolan har 200 anställda och ca 2 200 elever fördelade på 18 utbildningar, introduktionsprogram och anpassad gymnasieskola. Skolan har i över tio år varit en av de populäraste gymnasieskolorna i länet. I SKR:s jämförelser mellan kommunala gymnasieskolor i Sverige ligger Nacka gymnasium i topp.
   

  

 En riktig skola - så brukar våra elever beskriva Nacka gymnasium och det är en beskrivning som vi tycker stämmer bra. På Nacka gymnasium finns allt vad man kan förvänta sig av ett gymnasium där man tar utbildning på allvar. Helt enkelt en trygg miljö där förutsättningarna finns för att man som elev ska lyckas med sina studier.
   

  

 Vi söker en speciallärare med inriktning svenska samt med behörighet att undervisa i svenska och ytterligare något texttungt ämne på gymnasiet.
   

  

**Ditt uppdrag**
 Du är placerad i Lärcentrum och huvuddelen av ditt uppdrag är att vara en pedagogisk resurs inom skolan specialpedagogiska verksamhet. I Lärcentrum samverkar du med specialpedagoger och speciallärare samt bedriver stödundervisning och studiehandledning inom skolans stödverksamhet. I ditt uppdrag ingår också viss undervisning på nationellt program. Som lärare ansvarar du för planering, genomförande och utvärdering av din undervisning utifrån rådande läroplan, därtill samverkar du med skolans övriga lärare inom svenska samt elevhälsoteamet så att eleverna får en god utbildning och en bra studiesituation.
   

  

**Din erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* speciallärarexamen med inriktning svenska eller erfarenhet av specialpedagogiskt arbete
* lärarlegitimation och behörighet att undervisa i gymnasiets svenskkurser och ytterligare något texttungt ämne
* erfarenhet av undervisning på gymnasiet
* goda IT-kunskaper och erfarenhet av att arbeta i olika datasystem.


**Är det här du?**
* du har ett gott förhållningssätt och samarbetar professionellt med andra
* är modig, vågar göra, är självständig och utvärderar
* är lyhörd, lyssnar aktivt, arbetar med kunskapsspridning och kunskapsdelning
* är nytänkande och letar efter nya lösningar för att tillvarata varje elevs potential
* är mycket väl förtrogen med IKT, såväl i ditt dagliga arbete som ett arbetsverktyg i lärprocessen.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 På Nacka gymnasium värnar vi god undervisning. Här ingår du i ett kollegium med kompetenta, legitimerade och behöriga kollegor i en välfungerande och modern IT-miljö. Du har tillgång till goda resurser, välutrustade salar och inarbetade specialist- och stödfunktioner, som en välutbyggd elevhälsa, tillgängligt vaktmästeri och IT-support. Vi har ett stort och välfungerande skolbibliotek som kan komplettera undervisningen. Du har goda möjligheter till friskvård, kompetensutveckling och självklart har du en egen dator och arbetsplats. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

 I Nacka får du möjlighet att arbeta i en kommun som vill vara bäst i Sverige på att vara kommun, och som har öppenhet och mångfald som sin vision och en grundläggande värdering att lita på människors kunskap, vilja och förmåga.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidaretjänst med omfattning 80-100 %. Tillträde 11 augusti 2025.
   

  

 Om du vill bli en del av Nacka kommun, tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan! Om du vill veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta oss:
   

  

 Malin Söderberg, biträdande rektor, 08-718 81 04, malin.s.soderberg@nacka.se
   

  

 Johan Lundström, rektor, 08-718 81 08, johan.lundstrom@nacka.se
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden. Sista ansökningsdag 2025-05-07. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vårt rekryteringssystem. Vi ser fram emot att få din ansökan!
   

  

**Utdrag ur Polisens belastningsregister för skola och förskola krävs** 
 i samband med anställning. Vi ber dig att välja "digitalt registerutdrag" för snabbare hantering. Länk
   

  

 Tjänsten tillsätts under förutsättning att den inte behöver tas i anspråk för intern omplacering.
   

  

 Besök gärna Nackas kommunala skolor och förskolors karriärssida här
   

  

 Nacka är en av Sveriges mest attraktiva och välrenommerade kommuner. Med fokus på mål, resultat, hållbart medarbetarengagemang och ständig utveckling strävar Nacka efter att bli bäst på att vara kommun. Nacka kommun är arbetsgivaren för dig som med stor frihet förnyar och gör skillnad.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: deltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 80 % | Ort: Nacka | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/220 | Kontakt: Malin Söderberg (biträdande rektor) 08-7188104,malin.s.soderberg@nacka.se, Johan Lundström (rektor) 08-7188108,johan.lundstrom@nacka.se, | Facklig företrädare: Sveriges Lärare, Mikael Eriksson mikael.eriksson@nacka.se, | Publicerat: 2025-04-09 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-07

title: Azure Devops
description:
**Azure DevOps Consultant – Contract Assignment**  

Location: Hybrid (Stockholm area, Sweden)  

Start: ASAP | Duration: 6 months


An experienced DevOps professional is sought for a consultancy role supporting a client in modernizing and optimizing their cloud infrastructure on Microsoft Azure. The ideal candidate will have a solid foundation in infrastructure automation, containerization, and CI/CD, with a strong emphasis on best practices and operational excellence.

### **Main Responsibilities:**

* Architect and manage scalable, secure, and high-availability cloud environments using Azure services
* Build and maintain automated CI/CD pipelines following GitOps methodologies
* Implement infrastructure provisioning using Terraform and other Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools
* Manage and deploy container-based solutions including Azure Container Apps
* Work closely with development teams to streamline deployment and operational workflows
* Continuously monitor system health, identify bottlenecks, and improve performance and cost efficiency
* Ensure infrastructure and workflows meet security standards and compliance requirements

### **Required Skills & Qualifications:**

* Proven track record as a DevOps Engineer or in a similar role
* In-depth experience with Microsoft Azure, particularly Azure Container Apps
* Strong hands-on expertise with Terraform and IaC practices
* Solid understanding of GitOps, CI/CD tools, and Azure DevOps
* Skilled in container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes
* Proficient in scripting using Bash, PowerShell, or Python
* Familiar with observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, and Seq
* Excellent analytical skills, with a sharp eye for detail
* Comfortable collaborating across teams and communicating technical concepts clearly

 **About** **Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
InRule Technology®, Inc. is a PE-backed SaaS company with hundreds of customers in more than 40 countries. Our integrated decisioning, machine learning, and process automation software enables IT and business leaders to make better decisions faster, operationalize machine learning, and improve complex processes. We are proud to be trusted by some of the world’s largest banks, insurance companies, healthcare organizations, and governments for use in mission-critical applications. By making automation accessible, InRule increases productivity, drives revenue, and provides exceptional business outcomes.  

  

InRule is seeking a DevOps Engineer to join our growing team of experts. As a leading provider of business rules management systems (BRMS), we enable enterprises to automate decision logic and change rules without code. In this role, you will collaborate with developers, architects, and other team members to design, build, operate, and support our cloud services and infrastructure. Your work will ensure the optimal performance, security, scalability, and reliability of our cloud solutions.  

  

**Key Responsibilities*** Design, implement, and manage tools and processes for developing, deploying, monitoring, and supporting cloud infrastructure and services using technologies such as Azure DevOps, YAML, PowerShell, Terraform, ARM templates, Bicep, Cake scripts, Octopus, and TeamCity.
* Monitor and troubleshoot cloud resources and applications using Azure Monitor, Application Insights, Log Analytics, Sumo Logic, Seq, Zabbix, and other monitoring tools.
* Participate in scheduled on-call rotations with other CloudOps/DevOps team members.
* Analyze cloud resource usage to identify and implement cost optimization strategies.
* Contribute to the administration of the software development pipeline, enforce security policies, and support vulnerability detection and remediation.
* Automate and optimize operational workflows to improve cloud service efficiency and reliability.
* Develop and deploy monitoring tools and scripts for applications and infrastructure.
* Support deployment and configuration of InRule products, recommending architecture or design changes to enhance SaaS product performance.
* Collaborate with Support, Engineering, and IT teams to troubleshoot and resolve incidents while maintaining high service quality.
* Provide timely and effective technical support and guidance to internal and external customers.

**Desired Skills & Experience*** 3+ years of experience in DevOps, Cloud Operations, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), software engineering, or systems administration.
* Strong practical knowledge of Azure services (e.g., App Services, Functions, SQL Database, Cosmos DB, Storage, Key Vault).
* Proficiency in Azure CLI, PowerShell, Terraform, ARM templates, Bicep, YAML, C#, Python, JavaScript, T-SQL, and/or other scripting/development languages.
* Experience with CI/CD tools and practices, including Azure DevOps, Octopus, TeamCity, and DevOps methodologies.
* Skilled in configuring KPIs and diagnosing issues using various monitoring and logging tools.
* Comfortable debugging and maintaining .NET build projects using Cake and PowerShell.
* Familiar with networking, DNS, VPC, disaster recovery/failover, and database operations.
* Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Windows Server, and Linux systems (especially Ubuntu).
* Development experience creating tools for SaaS/PaaS product monitoring and management is a plus.
* Bonus points for knowledge of MongoDB, Tomcat, SharePoint, or Dynamics.
* Strong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills; customer service orientation is a plus.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Software Development, IT Engineering, or a related field.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively as part of a global team.

**Location*** Gothenburg or Stockholm (Residence in Sweden required)

title: Data Scientist / ML Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**

  

* Write modular, testable Python and SQL code for data science workflows and ML model development
* Apply core machine learning techniques, with an emphasis on time series forecasting
* Train and deploy ML models using Docker in cloud environments (e.g., Azure ML)
* Prepare and transform data using scalable, code-first pipelines (e.g., Databricks, dbt)
* Use Git-based version control and CI/CD pipelines to automate data workflows
* Work independently and proactively to move tasks and projects forward
* Collaborate in agile teams with data engineers, data governance specialists, and business stakeholders

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

  

* Strong experience in Python, SQL, and applied machine learning
* Practical knowledge of MLOps and scalable data pipeline frameworks
* Experience with cloud platforms (preferably Azure) and containerized ML deployment
* Familiar with agile methodologies and cross-functional collaboration
* Self-motivated with a solution-oriented mindset

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 07-05-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  


  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Service Reliability Engineer with AWS experience
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **3+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

  

Rollbeskrivning:

**Team description:**

The team you will work in is one of two global Service Reliability Engineering Team with team members located in the US and Sweden. There is close collaboration between the SRE teams as well as the DevOps teams responsible for developing and operating their services which are part of one or several solutions to one or several customers. The team is led by a Team Lead and works both with reactive service operation (support tickets from the OEM support organization) and proactive improvements.


**Need to have:**

* Excellent communication skills
* A strong interest and skills in problem solving
* AWS (or similar functionality provided by other cloud providers)
* DevOps experience with focus on Ops
* Observability (AWS CloudWatch, Grafana, Datadog or similar)
* Fluent English skills, in both speech and writing

**Nice to have:**

* Scripting and automation experience
* Programming experience (Java, Python or similar)
* Agile methodologies
* ITIL experience

**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

description:
